1.content:
You are ALEXANDER, hapless college student who lives on campus with his roommate TOM. Things are going a bit roughly at the moment. Your high school sweetheart, EMILY, is acting a bit disappointed in you right now, although the reason for this escapes you. Lately, she has been spending less time with you and more time with her best friend AMY. What Amy sees in Emily is beyond you. Although you see something in her, so it is not beyond the possibility that others do as well.

After finishing a two night cramming session for some important tests, a stressful day of academic ailments has finished and you are left to celebrate in the Friday night ritual of bar hopping. Tom has already started without you, and Emily has promised to talk to you, if she ever manages to find you.

It has been a cold Fall night, and your dark windbreaker jacket is beginning to prove insufficient to the dropping temperature as you walk towards your girlfriend's dorm on the opposite side of campus. Wind blows through the leafs as shivers suddenly climb up your spine.

It then dawns on you how empty the campus grounds are at 10:00 P.M. this night. Usually, there is the odd couple, or group of rowdy frat boys making motions in the distance, but tonight, there is nothing. Odd, there is that shiver again, and this time no wind. You turn the corner on a path, only see a young woman standing there.

At first you're not intimidated, because she is at least a foot shorter than you, in fact, you are more concerned that you scared her.
"Excuse me." you say as you try and pass her.

The woman does not budge.
"Excuse me." you repeat, as you attempt to step around her.
But the female's action mirror you as she stands right in your path.

The wind blows again, and you feel that shiver.

At this point, you feel a mix of concern, and annoyance. You did not want to have to show your strength, but something is wrong here. You powerfully walk straight at the woman. But to your surprise, she places both of her hands on your chest. Not sure what to think, you instinctively try and brush them off. However, before you can do that, one of her arms makes its way behind your neck, as she pulls herself up to kiss you.

Partly do to shock, and partially do to the unexpected weight of her on you, you fall backwards to the ground, as the woman jumps away.
"Sorry." she says as she dashes off into some bushes.

"What just happened?" you wonder.
1.title: It begins

choices: Continue to head to Emily's place
11.content:
You're deciding if you should tell of this incident to Emily, your girlfriend, when a sudden cramp hits you. As a cloud passes over a crescent moon, you collapse in pain. You try and scream, but all you can let out are some grunts. The cramp seems to move up, through your stomach and your chest. Your eye's are blurry, are you crying? There is enough pain to cry, but you haven't cried since you lost your pet in high school.

You try and peer down are what is causing you pain, but something graces your eye. You try and clear what is in front of your face, but just feel hair, long silky feeling hair. There is a pain in your hips, Not only does your skin in the region seem to be stretching, but the bones in that area seem to be becoming thicker too.

You grunt again, but this time, your grunt comes out at a higher pitch, that's not good. You remember a time when you strained your vocals while trying to sing that high. (You were really drunk that day.) The pain you had in your throat seems to be returning.

At this point, your mind is constantly thinking up the worst case scenarios to what is causing this. Some deadly disease that you never heard of, strange experiments from that old lab building that no one but the uber-nerds visit, fate hating you just for the hell of it.

The next part seemed the most bizarre, there was a clear deflating feeling between your legs, while there was a simultaneous swelling of your chest. These don't cause pain, as much as they cause pressure, a sensation you are not used to feeling. You try and hold in the noises, but your mouth lets out a feminine sounding "EEEE."

You attempt to hold your lips together, only to notice that they feel different as well. They almost feel fatter. Afraid of drawing unwanted attention from the non-existent passers by, you cover your mouth with your hands, only to feel that your jaw is much smoother. That was odd, you did shave just before you left, but your razor with pretty cheap. You should have at least felt something.

The last sensation you feel on the ground is your nipples. They're much more sensitive than usual, and every movement of your shirt is immediately noticeable.

After about a minute, you find the strength to stand, only to realize that when you do, the world seems a bit larger than it did before. You look down at your windbreaker and jeans. You find yourself leaning forward more. Not only is your center of gravity feeling different, you need to bend your neck forward just to see your stomach. Your windbreaker is tight on the top, as it seems you've developed some noticeable mounds on your upper torso. That said, your jacket's arms are much roomier than before. Your jeans also seem longer than before, They are pinching your waist, as your pant legs drag beneath your feet. Your feet, they feel odd too, not only do the socks keep falling to your heel, your shoes seem like they're going to slip off with every step.

Your head seems a bit fuzzy, and you are not currently thinking straight. The idea to head your place, or a health clinic never occurs to you. All that is on your mind is getting to one of the destinations.
11.title: Something happens immidiatly

choices: You hide your identity and pretend to be your cousin
You tell Amy the truth about who you are.
111.content:
Not in your right state of mind (but who would be after that experience?) You decide to take the shortest root to Emily and Amy's dorm apartment. While opening the building's main door, you catch your reflection in the doorway. It's not what you expected. Your hair looks uncombed, and is going every direction, plus, you have hundreds of smaller stray ends sticking out of the top. Your face looks thinner than before, and your eyes look larger and rounder. Your lips look like they're pouting, so instinctively, you try and suck them back in, but stop once you realize you just look stupid.

Your wondering what you're going to do with your voice on the intercom, when you call up Amy and Emily to let you in, but quickly realize that the inside door has been propped open, and you just head inside. The girls is in better shape than the guy's, but that is not saying much. You think for all the money that students pay to use the place, they'd fix up the crumbling drywall, or get some matching curtains for the hall windows. (Wait a minute, you never thought about curtains before, unless your thoughts involved a fake ghost.)

Ignoring the uncomfortable feeling in your chest, you finally make your way down to the girls' room.

Knocking on the door, you hear some quick chattering inside.
"Quick, he's here."
"I'm not ready, I don't want to see him until I am ready."
"You look fine, I am opening the door."
"No, don't! I haven't finished with my hair."
You hear a door inside the room shut.
"I'm letting him in, it would be rude to keep Alex waiting."

The door then opens and you see a girl your height look at you straight in the eye.
"Hi, who are you?" asks Amy in a surprised manner.

You just realized, in your current state, Amy and Emily would have no idea who you are.
111.title: Continue to head to Emily's place

choices: Emily tries to get more information out of you
Emil and Amy have heard enough and are ready to go out.
1111.content:
"I'm Alexandria." Alex's cousin, you say, not use to hearing the sound of your own voice.
"Oh." said Amy as her mind is contemplating something. Her expression is a mix between caution and acceptance. (Why are you starting to notice these things? Those observations never happened before.)
Finally, after a grueling 20 seconds, Amy smiles, opens the door and lets you in.
Entering the dorm room, you feel like you're an intruder, something just doesn't feel natural on you being here in your current condition.
Walking towards the couch, Amy notices you having to keep pull up your pants.
"Emily is just getting ready for her date tonight with her boyfriend." says Amy.
"Oh, you're not the one dating my cousin?" you say innocently.
Amy seems to be contemplating again about how to respond, but before she can, Emily comes out of the bathroom as she is brushing her hair.
"Who is this?" she says with some authority.
"I'm Alexandria, your boyfriend's cousin." you say.
"Oh that's weird, he never mentioned you." responds Emily.
"He never mentions any of us. But we're close. Private and close." you say, trying to get the girls to believe you.
"Well, you are wearing his shirt." realized Emily
1111.title: You hide your identity and pretend to be your c...

choices: You accept Amy's offer to get some new clothes.
You think that you're better off with the clothes you currently have on.
11111.content:
"So why did my boyfriend send you here?" Emily asked.

Quickly, trying to think of a response, you come across a beautiful lie.
"I was in town trying to get a place to stay for the night, when I was mugged, and lost everything." you say, throwing some false emotion into your words to make them believable. You continue: "I got off the train, and on my way to see my brother, someone stole my luggage and my purse." I spent most the afternoon in the police station filling out forms. When the officer called Alex, he came and picked me up, he even lent me some of his old clothes to wear."
Holding back from sobbing, the girls act like they genuinely believe your story. You even got Emily to recognize your clothes, and bring some authenticity you your relation with, well, yourself. (Wow, you just realized how conniving you were.)
"Oh you poor thing." says Amy as she puts her arm on your shoulder to try and make a connection.
"And you're cousin just sent you here to us, without any word of warning? Is he outside, I need to talk to him." stated Emily.
Quickly, a thousand different excuses pop into your head. None of them are good. "His cell died, and---he had to leave because of of the campus police was going to ticket him for parking illegally. He said he'd meet up with us and Tom at the local bar.

This lie was weaker than the first, but the girls seemed to believe it. Then after giving some non-verbal communication to each other, Amy and Emily return their focus to you.
"I think I know why your cousin sent you here." said Amy.
"You do?" you think, but all you can do is swallow your spit as you smile.
Emily nods her head and puts her hands on they sides of your stomach. "We're roughly about the same size." she smiles.
11111.title: Emily tries to get more information out of you

choices: Take her up on the offer
111111.content:
You don't feel that comfortable trying on Amy's old clothes, but your current clothes just were not made for your current body parts. Plus Amy seems genuinely interested in helping you, and to refuse would be a huge insult to her hospitality.
"I don't want to be any bother." You instinctively say, but Amy sees right past the false modesty.
"nonsense, after what you went through today, I want to put your faith back in human kindness, she says as she looks through her closet.

Amy takes out a pile of skirts, blouses and pants, half of them pink of frilly. That's when it occurs to you that this place looks more feminine than it did last time you were here. The window shades had designs on them. There are frilly pillows everywhere, even the lamps produce a pink glow. This is Amy's doing, she was slowly taking over your girlfriend's apartment. Emily looks at you, with what you could swear is pity in her eyes, then she walks back into the bathroom and shuts the door.

The next half hour is composed of you standing in front of a mirror trying on different types of outfits, that before tonight, you would rather have faced exile before wearing them. Thankfully, your (still somewhat) legs stop Amy from getting you to try on shirts, that is until she finds an extra pair of nylons, which you can never get to fit right.

After the 7th try, you and Amy both decide that tight jeans (because Amy owns no other kind) and blouse exposing your mid-section fit your personality best. You'd prefer something more conservative, but as your host, Amy is silently not allowing it.

Emily even starts to loosen up and comes out of her bathroom looking gorgeous, with a Hollywood live flare.

The three of you look in the full length mirror, and could all pass as lifelong friends. You offer to head out, but Amy stops with one last offer, she wants to fix up your face.
111111.title: You accept Amy's offer to get some new clot...

choices: Go and attempt to throw a football
You decide to hold off showboating
1111112.content:
You justified the clothes as being a necessary evil, but your willpower doesn't let you take it beyond that. After some debate with Amy, you tell her that you prefer the tomboy look. She says understands, although she really doesn't, but now secretly thinks that you're a lesbian. Amy even let you get away with borrowing a black pair of running shoes. (That was nice of her.)

As the three of you walk down the campus, Emily and Amy start to walk ahead of you, and get in a conversation about men. That cold wind blows, and a gust blows onto your stomach. It has just hit you how cold it is out, and how under-dressed you are for the weather. The wind causes your nipples to freeze, as you realize that Amy never let you borrow a bra.

Realizing the ridiculousness of the situation, an impulse to show off your athletic abilities hits you. In the distance, you see two football players throwing a football back and forth. Perhaps you can prove to yourself that you can still be just as active as when you were a guy. Or maybe you should hold off on trying to prove anything.
1111112.title: Head out like you are

11111121.content:
With all of this girly stuff going on, there is a drive within you to go and act like a guy. Drinking beer might help that, but the bar isn't right in front of you, and you don't know how well you could currently handle your drinks. Throwing a football should help you keep sane until you find out a bit more about what is happening, and how to reverse this.

Trying to walk like a guy feels a bit odd. It is still instinctual, but there is nothing hanging out in your leg area that you have to avoid hitting to protect. Eventually, you make your way to the two players, as you tap one on the shoulder.
"Excuse me," you say as you bend you neck back to look up at the guy, "could I make the next throw."

The jock looks at you for a second, trying to process what you just said to him. "Oh, ya, okay." he manages to stumble out. "Hey Larry, pass the ball to her." he says. "Okay." the other guy, (who is presumably Larry,) responds.

The ball is thrown very lightly, it might as well have been tossed underhanded. You feel insulted at this man's judgment on your abilities...that is, until the ball hits you. OUCH! That hurt more than you expected. It wasn't too bad of a catch though, you were just not used to the current sensitivity of your skin, and the lack of upper body muscles.

You've thrown a football with friends before, you know what most girls don't, the technique. This will show them. (Who are you kidding, this will show you.) You take the ball in your right hand and spread your fingers around the bumpy grips. You then toss the ball forward, only to find that you didn't adjust for your wieght, and almost fall forward. The player that you talked to quickly wraps one arm around your stomach to stop you from falling. The ball itself goes about five feet before hitting the pavement and bouncing out into the road.

"That's a good start." says the guy holding you, as he releases his grip to let you get your balance back. The other guy quickly runs out into the street to pick up the ball before a car hits it.

"Why does this happen to me?" says a voice inside of your head.

"You had the grip about right, it was your release that was all wrong." says the jock. "I can quickly teach you if you'd like."

You look at Amy and Emily standing about ten yards back. Amy's motion is suggesting you take the guy's offer. Emily is looking impatient.
11111121.title: Go and attempt to throw a football

111111211.content:
"Sure. Teach me." you say.
A feeling in the back of your mind tells you that you shouldn't be doing this, but a bunch of reasons jump into your head about why you should. The longer it takes to get to the bar, the less that Emily might feel that you (Alexander) are potentially standing her up. Plus if you screwed up a throw that badly, and just walked away, the guys might think you're being a dick.

"Okay, step one. Take the ball, and put it in your hands." says the jock and he places the football in your palm.
"What now?" you ask.
"Then you need to space your fingers out, so that there is one between every other stitch." says the guy as he starts spreading your fingers for you.
"Step two, stand up straight." says the jock, as he slowly puts his hands on your waist. You don't like this at all, but the shock of his hands does get you to stand up straight.
"Now move your left leg forward." says the jock, and you immediately put it in the proper position to stop him from trying to move your leg for you. He seems impressed by this.
"Good, now just move the right arm behind your ear." he says as he pulls your arm back. "Then when you're ready to throw, just spring your arm forward, and when your arm is past your face, release."

You give his instructions a shot, and to your dismay, they work, the ball goes a good fifteen feet into the arms of the player you assume is named Larry.

"Wow, thanks for the lessons." you say. As you say this, you notice that your fingers are playing with you hair. You immediately jerk your arm down to the side to put a stop to it. "Well, I have to go now. Thanks for everything." you say.
But before you can leave, the guy shouts. "Where are you off to?"
You try and think if you should even respond or not, but Amy thinks for you. "We're heading to the bar just outside of campus." she says. Then, in a sentence that she seems to have added for the sole purpose of making life more difficult, adds: "You're welcome to come.

The guys seem more than pleased to join your trek to the bar, as they follow you. In the guy's defense, the jock that showed you how to throw a football seems to have gotten the hint that he crossed a line and invaded your comfort zone. However, you can't help but get the feeling that he is staring at your ass the entire way to the bar.
111111211.title: Take the offer

choices: Leave and meet up with Amy
1111112111.content:
The bar is not the best in the city, but it is the largest one in this area of town. There is a small line to get in it, and as luck would have it, it is ladies night. Your feeling mixed on this, on one hand, you can get in free and get cheap drinks, on the other hand, there will be a lot of desperate men waiting in there.

Music plays in the background, but it is hard to hear over people's conversations. There is also a baseball game playing. You don't know the teams or if it is a repeat broadcast, your too disinterested to focus on it for more than a second. (Which is rather odd, since Baseball would have at least been able to hypnotize you for five minutes before you came to your senses and realized that you were watching Baseball.)

The guys go to the bar's counter, while you and the girls find an empty table and sit down for a bit.
Emily seems to be looking around for your cousin (a.k.a. you,) but she can't seem to find him. After about a minute of scoping the place out, Emily then turns to you and Amy. "So, what do you think about the two guys you brought here?" she asks.
You and Amy look at each other, before Amy looks back at Emily. "I think the tall one is so HOT." she says, referring to Larry.
"You're not going to bring him to our room are you?" asks Emily.
"Maybe." says Amy with a blush as she bites her lip. "I think the other one likes you." Amy continues, giving you a chance to respond.
...
"I'm just passing through town for tonight. I don't want to do anything I can't return to finish." you say, not entirely sure what you just meant.
"Oh you should totally, go for it." responds Amy.
"And bring him where? I don't want to cause my cousin any trouble, or go missing on him." you answer.
"Speaking about your cousin, I think I just saw him go out the back." says Emily as she stands up and leaves.

Two minutes pass.

"I'm going to the bathroom, I'll be just a second." says Amy as she leaves.
About a second after she gets out of sight, the jock that showed you how to throw a football comes to your table and sits down.
"Hi, I am Ed." he slyly says, which triggers your fight or flight response.
1111112111.title: continue to the bar

choices: Take her advice and try it
No, that sounds like a bad idea, ignore her advice
11111121112.content:
Your mind panics. What do women want to do if they want to be left alone? What signals to they give? Are you giving Ed signals you don't know about? This is somehow your fault, isn't it? Your mind races until it thinks of the one safe place that the jock can't follow you.
"I have to use the ladies room." you blurt out.
Both Ed and you seemed stunned at how inelegantly you phrased that. Ed just sits still as you leave and try to find washroom.

After about a minute of searching, you come across a door with a small line up of women in front of it. This must be the place. Single file, the line gets shorter and shorter until you arrive inside.
You realize you've never been into a woman's washroom before. No urinals, but the lighting is better, there is a soiled couch in the corner and a missing door on one of the stalls. The paint is a faint pink, and there a broken tampon dispenser next to the giant mirror. At least two women are using the mirror to apply their make up, and one of them is Amy.

"Hi Amy." you say cautiously, having no clue how women communicate in here.
"Oh, what are you doing here?" asks Amy, noticing that you aren't going to the free toilet.
"I'm here to get away from Ed. They guy can't take a hint." you tell her.
"Oh, is that all?" she replies.
"What do you mean?"
"I mean he's reading the signals your giving him. And I think you're his type."
"My type?"
"Ya, jocks like two types of girls, the weak sissy ones that they can protect, and the tomboys that can keep up with them. You mademoiselle, are the second type."

Thinking about it for a moment, you realize she might be right. A lot of jocks are narcissistic, and you are acting like a guy, (at least acting more like one than most women do.)

"So what should I do?" you ask her.
"Well, try on something that goes against type." she responds taking out a lipstick tube.
11111121112.title: Leave and meet up with Amy

111111211121.content:
You don't like the idea, but Amy seems to know more about surviving as a girl than you do. Plus if it works, you can get some space to think. Then maybe you'll be able to think of a way to change back, and meet up with Emily.

Amy takes out a bright red tube and hands it to you, only to have you stare at it, until she realizes you have no clue what you are doing. Then holding the tube up to your lips, she presses it against them, and applies it for you. You look into the mirror, only to find that you don't like what you see. The shade of red is too bright, it seems like your seeking attention, or are too needy. At least it directs peoples eyes away from your chest. Maybe if they start reading your lips, you'll feel more like your old self again.

"Now go out there. And good luck." says Amy as she pushes you out the door.

You walk through the bar, feeling peoples eyes on you. A lot more eyes then before. Every guy's stare is creeping you out, every women is looking at you with the slight hint of hate in their eyes. You try and give a very mild smile as you return to your table. Where Ed is still sitting and talking with Jerry. Upon seeing you, Jerry pats Ed on the shoulder and walks off. You carefully sit, trying to compose yourself and sit more upright.

"Sorry about the wait." you say.
"No problem, I bought myself a beer to pass the time." said Ed.
"Oh, I don't like beer very much." you say, trying put some barriers between you.
"Neither do I. I just drink on special occasions." he responds, looking at your face. (It's better than him glaring at your ass.)
"Is there a special occasion?"
"I met you. That should count for something."

Oh, wow.
You look around the bar frantically. This guy is coming on too fast. Either he has no experience with women, or tons, either possibility will be a problem. You then see that Amy is flirting with Jerry, she doesn't notice you.

Just then Emily returns looking annoyed. This could be just the distraction you needed.
"I can't find your cousin anywhere." she says to you.
"Oh, I can help you look." you say.
She pulls you aside, then softly says, "no, it's fine, I see your busy. That color suits you."

Emily then quickly leaves.
There is one last chance, you look around for Tom. If he is here, maybe he can save you.
Nope, no luck there. Finally, you just flat out tell him:

"Ed, I'm sorry, I don't know what I am doing. I think I'm giving you signals that I don't mean to. I got taken here with my friends, who left me and now I just want to head back to my dorm room apartment."

Ed looks at you, and is a bit disappointed, but understands. He then asks your address, and wouldn't you know it, he lives in the same building. In the floor right above you. This cheers him up a bit more, he even offers to walk you home.
111111211121.title: Take her advice and try it

1111112111211.content:
Sure, what the heck, you're both heading to the same destination. Plus it is dark out, it's not safe for a young woman to be walking across campus alone at this time of night. Also, if anyone sees you with Ed, they'll probably assume you're with him and leave you alone. (You don't usually think this strategically.)

As much as you hate to admit it, it is kind of comforting to have Ed around you. It's not that you like him or anything, but currently, you're in one of the most vulnerable positions in your life, and having someone who can help stop potential dangers before they start is comforting. Still you don't know to much about this guy, although your intuition tells you that he's not much of a threat once put in his place. (Intuition, huh, you never really had that working in your favor before.)

It's a pretty quiet walk home, as you don't feel like initiating a conversation, and Ed isn't that persistent. You don't know why he keeps following you, is he really that chivalrous? (You never were to any girls.) Maybe he is hoping for a last minute change of mind from you, or perhaps he's just gay.

It's a long and chilly walk home, and the wind hitting against your diminished body mass isn't helping matters either. Thankfully, you eventually make it back to your building, and Ed holds the door open for you. (What a gentleman!) You both walk up the stairwell together until you reach your floor.

"Well, this is it." says Ed, "I'm not going to lie to you, when you first approached me, I thought there would be something between us. Now I know I was mistaken. Good Night."

But is it really good night? You could let him down gently, maybe walk him to his room to show there are no hard feelings. (Wait? What are you thinking? That is an incredibly bad idea!)

You look up at him and slowly reply:
1111112111211.title: Accept his offer

11111121112111.content:
It was a nice night, but it is over, your mind won't allow you to do anything beyond what you already have. Ed walks upstairs, and you walk into your room. You're tired, the night seemed pointless. You wonder how you'll fix things up with Emily.
You wash your face, and then turn in for the night.

You awake the next morning to a welcome surprise. Your manhood has once again appeared. You don't know what happened, and currently, you don't care. You're willing to accept that it was all a dream. Except you trip on a pair of Amy's jeans and fall flat on your face.

Oh well, for now at least, life is good.
11111121112111.title: This is goodbye

11111121112112.content:
Despite your better judgment, you did feel bad for Ed, after all, you have been giving him mixed signals all night, and despite the touching when first teaching you to throw a football, he has kept his hands off you since.

"I don't want to end it like this." you say, as you start up the final level of stairs.
"I'm not following you." says Ed suspiciously.

(Crap, you're doing it again. Stop that! Just say what you mean.)

"Look it's not so hard to figure out. You're being all chivalrous the last part of the night, after you were ready to jump me when we first met. Dropping me off at my floor is pathetic." you say with some harshness.

Ed looks stunned.
"And I can't let a nice guy like you seem so pathetic...so I'm going to drop you off at yours." you finish.

Before you can fully grasp what is going on, you arrive in front of Ed's dorm room. He opens the door and walks inside, but is slow to close it. He turns around towards you. "Well, thanks." he says, not sure how to say goodbye.

A minute passes and you find yourself just standing there looking at him.
"Either do something or go away, I don't feel good slamming this door in your face." says Ed.

There is that chill again, but this time there is no wind. Before you can stop yourself, to step into his room and grab the front of his shirt.
"Finally!" Ed says with some satisfaction. You try and pull yourself away, but all you do is pull yourself up and give him a kiss. It doesn't feel right, you think there might be tongue involved.

You push yourself away, horrified of what you just did. (What did you do?) You step back out into the hallway.
"What?" Ed asks. At this point, you can tell he is trying to hide how annoyed he is.
"I'm sorry." you say with a pitiful feminine voice.

Ed ties to take a step forward, when he is stopped by a terrible crap in his stomach. All of a sudden, he falls to the ground and starts moaning in pain. You quickly close the door so that other people can't hear.
The transformation is amazing, you can't bring yourself to look away. The deflation and inflation of certain body parts. The softening of the skin, the subtle re-arrangement of the face. All that you can think of is that you caused this.

That flight or fight reflect kicks in, and you have the option of leaving and disappearing into the campus, or staying and explaining the situation to him.
11111121112112.title: The nights not over yet

111111211121121.content:
It happened to you, and now you'll let it happen to him. You tell yourself that it is the cycle of such things. You leave his room and run and hide in yours. You try to sleep that night, but are unable to rest until the sun rises. At that point, you wake up after only an hours worth of sleep, and find that you're male again.

So what happened to you that night? You'll probably never know, but since you never deal with the transformation again, you don't really care. Emily is mad that you stood her up, but you work it out, in time.
111111211121121.title: Leave

111111211121122.content:
You want to run, but in your heart, you know that that isn't the right thing to do. You wait until Ed gets up, and are almost jealous that he makes a better looking woman than you do. (Stupid instincts.) You try your best to explain to him what happened that night, about your encounter with a mysterious woman that did this to you. Ed, gets mad and tries to punch you, but is not use to his new proportions and falls over crying. Feeling empathy, you hold her (him?) until she calms down.

"So what do we do now?" asks Ed.
"I don't know, get used to our new lives? Wait for the sun to come up, and hopefully change us back? Maybe we can have a slumber party." you joke. The joke is lame, but at this point, you'll take anything to lighten the mood.

"Wow, I mean, I was ready to claw your eyes out." Emily says as she sits down.

"Oh ya, your all he talked about once he picked me up and drove me over here. In fact, he'll probably kill me for ruining the surprise, but check this out..." you say as you go to your desk.
"Two tickets to tomorrow's dance." you say, trying to acted excited.
"Are those real?" she asks.
"Yes, why?"
"They sold out hours ago, I didn't think I was going to go." she says standing up.
"That's so awesome!" you say.
"I know!"
"I'm so happy for you."
"I need to get ready tomorrow!" she squeaks.

"You should come! and get ready with me tomorrow!" she says.

The atmosphere has calmed down a bit. You just realized what happened, and that you probably insulted her. You try and look at her with understanding eyes.

You two just stare blankly at each other for a bit.
"I've got to go." says Emily.

"I enjoyed getting to know you a bit." you say waving.
"Me too. You're one of the few girls I don't feel I have to be defensive with." she says as she walks down the hall.

You close the door, and lay back on your bed, looking up at the ceiling. You can't believe what a close call you just had. That conversation could have become so disastrous.

You look at your breasts; they are nice when they're temporary, and still. Still, you won't miss walking around with them, or wearing a bra. You look out the window, the sun has gone down. You can smell the night air though, which is odd, since the window is closed.

Oh well, if Brian was right, you could defeat this curse by morning.

You try and think if you've learned anything from the situation, and realize that all you learned was how great it is to have a penis. Something that if you've read Emily's signals correctly, you'll be making some good use of before tomorrow's sun comes up.

Thinking of this, you get dressed up, and since you're a guy, getting ready takes under a half hour as you prepare for the dance. You look up and see yourself staring back at you.
"What's going on?" Alex says to you.
"I don't know." you say, with your higher pitched voice.
There is something different about your voice, it doesn't sound like a more feminine version of your own, it sounds like Emily's.
You panic for a second. You can taste the cherry flavored lipstick she put on. Quickly you look down at your arm and see you are wearing her clothes and holding her handbag.
You're body is padding itself down. "What's going on?" squeaks your body.
"Emily, are you okay?" you ask.
"I'm, I'm..." your body says, catching it's breath.

"You're Alex!" you body says.
"Yes, as far as I can tell, we just switched bodies." you say.
"How are you so calm?"
"Believe me, this isn't the first strange thing that's happened this week."
"What do we do?" asks your body, obviously having trouble walking.
"We go see Brian. If anyone knows what to do, it'll be Brian. But he lives just outside the other side of campus."
"Then what are we waiting for? Let's go." Alex says.
"Let's take a cab." you say, "This footwear is killing me."

You get a cab ride to Brian's place, and Emily, in your body, pays for it. You'd be more impressed, except she's using your wallet.
You make it to Brian's room, and walk on the door.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111111.title: You're not you

1211111111111111111111111112111121111111.content:
"Come back tomorrow." says a voice on the other side of the door.
"This is an emergency." you yell as you bang on the door with what seem to be your newly manicured hands. (Pink nails, very classy.)
"Fine, just a minute." says Brian as he comes to open the door.
"I've already got company, what do you want?" asks Brian.
"I've gotten in trouble again." you say.
"Alex?" Brian asks, putting while putting on same glasses, and looking at the person behind you.
"Yes." you respond.
Brian jumps back in surprise.
"Sorry, I'm not used to this." he says, "Come on in."

Emily and you walk into his apartment, where surprise of surprise, Alice is sitting down.
"You!" Alice says in a harsh voice looking at Emily (in your body.)
"What did I do?" Emily says nervously.
"Trust me, that guy doesn't remember a thing." you say.

"What's she doing here?" you ask Brian.
"Same thing you were; looking for answers and a cure."
"How did she find you?" you ask.
"Also has connections at the library...I'm sorry, this is too weird." says Brian.

"Tell me about it." you say, trying to bring attention to your new features.

You later tell him what happened with the rose, and as it turns out Brian actually knows that story.
"Just give it a week." he says.
"A week?" you ask.
"Ya, there are three different versions of this story, all of them involve lovers being each other for a week."
"Another week of not being me?" you say.
"Hey, at least this time your just your girlfriend, and not some hermaphroditic metamorphosing freak.---Relax, have fun, it'll be another crazy adventure, but at least your last one came to..."

You knock for five minutes. Nothing.
Eventually, you knock on the next door, and Brian's neighbor answers.
"Yes?" says the neighbor.
"I'm sorry to disturb you, but do you know where Brian is?" you ask sheepishly.
"Ya, he took his date to the dance." says the neighbor.
"Thank you so much, mister!" you say, putting on a bit of a show.

"What's going on? asks Emily, using your voice.
"Looks like you're taking me to the dance." says the voice.

One cab ride later, you arrive at the dance, and the event has already started.
"Oh, I live this song." says Emily, for some reason you get the feeling, she's not quite as eager to switch back as you are.

You look around for a but, but it's dark, and you don't see anyone.

Suddenly, you spot Dale. he actually came to this thing? Well, he is dancing with somebody. Somebody who looks a lot like Alice.
"I'm sorry my friend was such a bitch and stood you up." you hear Alice say to him, as they dance.
"No worries, besides, I think I'm going to be much happier spending this evening with you." he replies. (Ew!)

You keep looking, you see one of the nerds from the movie theater. Wow, even they have girlfriends.
Eventually, you come across Brian, who is dancing with some girl you've never seen before.
"Brian!" you say.
"Excuse me, I'm in the middle of a dance." Brian replies.
"It's me Alex!" you say.
"Who is Alex?" asks the girl dancing.
"Aaaand, you ruing the moment." says Brian to you.
"Sorry." you reply.
"So you're..."
"Alex."
"With the..."
"Gender issues. Ya. Look, I..."
"Wow, you clean up nice. I didn't even recognize you. In fact, I thought you were cured."
"Who is Alex?" asks his date.
"Student I'm tutoring." he replied.
"Look, I'm not me, I'm Emily, my girlfriend." you reply.
Suddenly, Emily, catches up with you.
"Hey Alex." says Brian.
"Um...hi." Emily giggles.
"Can you help us?" you ask.

Brian thinks for a moment.
"Probably, but not tonight. This just sounds like an overused plot device. Body swaps happen in fiction all of the time. 99% of the time they're temporary. Come see me at noon tomorrow, and I'll help you out." he says.
"Thank you." you say hugging him.
"Okay, cut that out." says Brian, "I still find this whole situation creepy."

Brian than walks up to his date, and continues dancing.

"Well, what do we do now?" asks Emily, as she looks down at you with your body.
"I don't know, Brian says he can probably fix it tomorrow." you tell Emily.
"That's good, but what do we do until then?"
"Well, you did seem to want to be at this dance." you say.
"A new slow song is starting." says Emily.
"And no handsome guy has asked me to dance yet." you respond light heatedly.
"Oh, where are my manners, you delicate young goddess." Emily says, holding your hand up, as an invitation to take it.
"Why thank you sir." you say, as you accept.
You put your arms around Emily's neck as she grabs your hips and pulls you closer. Your breasts squeeze against Emily, as her penis grows, pushing out her pants against you.
"Sorry." she says.
"It's okay." you say as you rest your head on Emily's shoulder.
"Whose leading?" she asks.
"You are. I don't want people coming back from this dance thinking I'm gay." you say.
You start to sway to the music, as you close your make up heavy eyes.
"Alex?" says Emily.
"Yes?" you say.
"You look pretty."
"Thanks," you reply as you continue dancing with your eyes close.
In your head, you imagine that you're at this dance in your appropriate body.

"Well, it could be worse." you think, as you see Dale going home with Alice out of the corner of your eye.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111111.title: Brian's Date

1211111111111111111111111112111121111111.content:
With all of the crazy stuff that has happened to you in the last seven days, you were sure something strange was about to happen. But you're still you, Emily hasn't been transformed into a pig, and you realize that sometimes a rose is just a rose.

Getting to a dance, you have a wonderful night, and realize that everything is returning to status quo. Even Tom is there with his girlfriend of the week, you talk to him, and tell him that it's safe to move back in with you.

A week later, everything goes back to normal, except that Amy now dating that fat Korean guy who hangs out at the campus tavern. You even say Alan once or twice walking around campus. Turns out he's mostly male during the day, but has a higher voice than most. (And you're too polite to ask him why that is.) He still has girl issues at night, but he's getting better at dealing with them, and is taking prescription testosterone medicine. With any luck, he'll be cured by the time he graduates.

That guy you dealt with in the incident in the washroom, apparently dropped out of school the next week, but there is a woman who looks very similar to him who is known for calling everyone 'bitch.'

As for you? Well, life isn't bad, you find yourself occasionally crying at sappy movies more than you should, but otherwise it's like this whole thing never happened.

A year passes, and the adventures of that week seem like little more than a bad dream, and you have no psychological scars to show for it. Meaning you survived an experience that would have seriously altered most people for the remainder of their lifetime.

Good for you!

Before you can fall asleep, there is a knocking at your door. You slowly get up to answer it, but as you do the knocks become louder.

There is some sobbing.

Eventually, you open the door and let Alice in, hoping you won't regret this.
Alice walks in, crying. But you leave the door open, just in case you need to make a quick escape.
"What's going on?" you finally ask her.

You nod.

"My feminine energy was steadily draining since I met you. I could almost pass as a male during the day again.---Now they stopped.---What did you do?"

"But I had maybe a day left before I was normal again."

As you return from getting the glass, Alice is nowhere to be found. You peek out into the hallway to see if she's there. You notice Ted, one of the other students on this floor quickly take a picture of you with his camera as you look out. Ted quickly puts the phone away and walk into his room, closing the door. Life is treating you well. You feel great, like you could punch through a wall for the fun of it. You don't know if you're overcompensating or if your body is dealing with a sudden re-emergence of testosterone, but you want to do something.

So you do. Going out for a run, which quickly becomes a jog, that devolves into a walk, you come across Tom. "I'm back, so you can move in." you say to him.

The conversation devolves from there.

"Wow." says Emily, "that was the..."

The rest of the dance is uneventful, and you use your regained strength to take her by the hand and lead her back to your dorm.

Along the way you pass by two girls arguing. "What are you doing with my man's shirt?" says one. "Bitch, I told you it's mine." says the second girl, who looks like she could be the twin-sister of that guy to harassed you in the washroom the other day.

You exit to see Emily looking a bit mad at you.

You're having a bad dream, an experimental procedure gone wrong, aliens; all these excuses start flooding into your brain. You then realize that she probably wouldn't believe the truth anyways, so that's exactly what you tell her.
"I'm sorry. I can't deal with this right now. She says as she leaves.

Three days later you get a knock on your dorm door.

Emily is there, holding four bags of stuff.

"Emily." you say.

"No, it's not okay. I panicked and ran out when you needed me."

"Just shut up and listen. I went through mine and Amy's old stuff, I grabbed a few of our things, you help you better go through your situation." she says as she passes the bags to you.
You look through the bags, looking to see what you can find. A few old dresses, a pair of nylons, a few blouses and skirts, some make up, and a tampon.
"Lovely." you say as you hold up the tampon.
"Look, I still like you for you. Not the physical you, but what's inside." she says.

"What?" says Emily, "If someone does all this work to help you out, you don't just shove it back at them."
"Emily..."
"...I just want to help you Alex."
"I'm not a cross dresser...or a woman." you say.
"But I saw..."
"What you saw the the last of some tainted energy venting itself. I talked to my friend Brian about it. Also, I haven't changed for the last two nights." you finally say.
"So I'm all better. I'm cured."
"Oh." says Emily.

Emily looks kind of disappointed.

"I'm not in the mood for it now." says Emily as she sits on your bed.

"Women." you think, "I'll never understand them."

choices: That no part of you changed back in the morning.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
You don't want to do it. You really don't want to do it. But when you get to your room, you prepare to call Dale.
Unfolding the napkin that was still in your back pocket, you dial the numbers and wait for him to answer.
"How did Emily get me to do stuff over the phone?" you think. Did she giggle? Use a sultry voice? (Wait, you just want him to get you access to Alice, you don't want him to think he has a chance with you.) All of your thought process comes to nothing though as a recorded voice asks to you leave a message.
"Hi, it's me Alex. I thought about it and want to take you up on your offer to go to the dance." you say, before hanging up.
(Wasn't that painless?)
You look at your watch, there is plenty of time until the dance. You look through your closet, and find some great shirts for dressing up in, for a person who is a few sizes bigger than you, and male.

There is really nothing else you can do today, so you figure you might as well get ahead on your studies, and pray that Emily doesn't decide to visit you.

Thankfully, the night proves uneventful, as night comes, you become fully female like you have the last few nights, but the change is so sudden and minor, that you don't even notice it until you try to go to the bathroom, two hours after nightfall.

Eventually, you decide that you're going to call it a night. So you take of the bra, and dress, and hide them under your bed and you turn off the lights and close your eyes.

You wake up the next morning to find...
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Go and call Dale

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
"Oh, this can't be good." you think as you look under the covers to find that even during the daytime, you're fully transformed.
Across the room, you hear Tom snoring, he must have sneaked in late last night. Thankfully, the guy keeps to himself.
You lift up your armpits and take a whiff. Yuck. It didn't really bother you last night, but today, your body odor is really upsetting you.
Going into your bathroom, you decide if you should put on some cologne, or take a shower first. You decide against taking a shower, because that could risk waking Tom. Looking at the mirror, you feel bad about how messy your hair is. It's all over the place, there are some loose ends, and you don't want to walk outside like that. Other girls would probably think you spent the night as a strange man's house, and for some reason, you don't feel like getting that sort of reputation. (Seriously? Why do you care what other girls think?! You're not going to stay like this for long, right? Right?!)

After brushing the ends of your hair, you find another elastic band, and try hard to put it into a ponytail. After about thirteen minutes of failing and making a fool of yourself, you decide to look presentable enough to be seen in public.

Walking back to your bedroom, you look at your 'borrowed' dress, and purchased sports bra. Holding them both up to you, you can't bring yourself to put them back on. You tell yourself that it's because you are still a man inside, and you reject those items of clothing. But really, you just don't feel like wearing the same outfit two days in a row.

You grab a light white dress shirt that you used to wear to job interviews. It may be cold, but at least it's not made of wool, and will make your nipples will be slightly more comfortable when they rub against it. You then throw on a pair of black pants, and hold them up by tightening your belt around them. For warmth, you put on your windbreaker, as you head out, silently closing the door, so that you do not wake up Tom.

The second the door shuts, you realize something, Tom isn't in your room. You quickly reopen the door and take a peak inside, there is no one there. (What the hell?) You have a sudden urge to get as far away from your room as possible.

As you walk out of your building, you begin to notice something, your body seems to be guiding you. You want to think that you're in control, but your moves feel more instinctive.

As you walk further away from your dorm, you realize where you are heading to...
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: That no part of you changed back in the morning.

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
Before you know it, you're walking to the edge of campus, where a small gathering of bored individuals wait at the bus stop. Your body sways towards them as you stand right next to the bench. You notice that one of the girls there makes a quick but harsh glance at you. After a short ten minute wait, the bus comes and you all get on. Thankfully, the driver seems to apathetic to look at your student bus pass, and notice that you look different than the photo ID accompanying it.

The bus is crowded, but there are still some empty seats for you to sit down at. Your body makes the choice to sit down and rest a bit. About two stops later, the bus is completely full, and your sitting between two large men. The one on your left is some sort of football player, and the one on your right is an overweight nerd.

The bus makes some sharp turns as it moves through the city. Causing the the men on both sides of you to occasionally press against you. The nerd looks at you with a glance that says 'I'm sorry.' but doesn't mention anything more than that.

After about ten minutes, the nerd gets up to exit the bus, and as he does so, you notice a bit of a bulge in his pants. (Did you help create that?) Feeling a bit disgusted, you try and get that image out of your mind. Another woman sits down where the nerd was and keeps looking at you. You don't know why, and are now beginning to think that there might be something wrong with the way you look.

Eventually, signal you want off the bus, stand up, and start pressing against people to make your way towards the exit. You brush against five people before finally leaving the crowded piece of public transit. As you exit the bus, you find yourself in the run down part of town. Looking around, you see that in walking distance is a dollar store and a Goodwill location. Your body starts walking towards Goodwill.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: On the bus

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
Before you know it, you're in the shop, looking at the dress section. Around you are volunteers, and some creepy customers. You try to stay in the woman's section, not because the stuff there interests you, but more because there is less of a chance one of the weirdos would walk towards you.
Pretending to be distracted, you look through the one piece dresses. Many of them look like prom dresses from the nineties. One of them looks like it came right out of the seventies, complete with satin flowers folded into the torso. One of the dresses was a colour that could only be described as puke green. They all look stupid. And they're all around 30 dollars, a price that you could probably afford.

Closing your eyes, you randomly pick three, and race to the change room so that the weirdos have less of a chance to look at you. After finally figuring out how to slip into the one piece dresses, (turns out you slip in through the bottom,) you find out that only the blue one fits you. You look at the mirror, in the tight room, and agree that you look presentable. Which is fine, as you probably don't want to draw attention to yourself, either by looking to good or bad. Blue is a safe masculine colour.

Putting the other dresses back, you browse through the shoe section, and notice some lovely sandals. (They look comfortable.) But something inside of you won't let you buy them to wear with the dress. Instead you find your eyes wandering over to the heeled footwear. (Oh look, blue ones!) A pair of shoes in the corner actually look like they were made to be worn with the blue dress in your hand. You look at the five dollar price tag and sigh. (Although a little voice in the back of your mind lets out a joyous squeal.)

In line, you wait in front of an old woman who is close to being blind and cannot remember her card's PIN, and are in front of a tall, dark, and fat man who is breathing heavily. Finally, you are about to buy the dress when the cashier looks at you and says "Oh, I bet you will look so lovely in this."
"It's for my sister." you instinctively lie. "But thanks." you finish, trying to be polite and seem like you weren't offended.

The total of your purchase comes to under $40. You pay for it with some money you had kept hidden in your closet from Tom.

You run to catch the bus until you realize that the cashier didn't give you a bag. Walking onto the bus, you feel like a fool holding onto the dress and shoes with one hand, and holding onto a poll with the other. You feel the eyes of everyone looking at you, as they're probably imagining how dorky you'll look in that dress.

You make one more unimportant stop before returning to your apartment.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Getting the Dress

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
As you get out at the campus bus stop closest to your apartment, you find your eyes starting to wander and focus on minute details that you didn't notice before. You notice a woman wearing nylons with a pink skirt. (You'd still have noticed that before your transformation, but instead of noticing how sexy they make her look, you just notice hot they clash with her pink skirt.) You keep glancing at other girls' hairstyles and thinking which one would look best on you, and how practical some styles might be for you to try out for tonight.

Suddenly, you catch yourself about what you were thinking, and attempt to stop it. You notice other people giving you weird looks as you carry the dress to your building. You start trying to think of manly things like football, and baseball, and fixing cars, but find yourself having to stop when you mind starts to focus on how good their bodies look.

Eventually, you give in, and start judging other women as you go back towards your room. Some other girl starts walking beside you, and you notice that she is examining your dress. You look her over, and notice that she is wearing blue nail polish, that's the same shade as your dress. You smile at her as you walk up to your building, but inside, you feel a bit scared that she's going to wear a similar outfit to yours.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Wandering Thoughts

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
You get to your room, and throw down your outfit on your bed. Looking to the side, you notice that Tom isn't there, and hasn't really been in your life much lately.

Looking back at the spread out dress on your bed sheets, you wonder why you keep looking at this thing.
You look at the time and realize that the dance starts in three hours. Elsewhere, girls in the campus are getting together and helping each other get ready. Here, you are by yourself, with no real clue what you are doing.

There is an empty feeling inside you, and you can't explain it, you just put the dress up to the mirror, and decide that now is the best time to get ready. You don't even want to, but you decide that you should probably practice wearing and moving around in this thing.

Sighing, you throw on the dress, and look in the bathroom mirror. You look incredibly gay in this lighting. You force a smile, but still come off looking more masculine than you should in this thing. (It's got to be the lighting.) You stop yourself, when you just realized how scary it was that thinking of yourself as masculine was a bad thing.

Looking at yourself in the mirror, you noticed that this dress was designed to be worn without a bra. Thankfully, your breasts are small enough that they fit loosely in the dress, however, they aren't held well in there. If you're not careful, they'll move around all night, and bring some unwanted attention to you. Just something you note to yourself, before you try on your shoes.

As you put on your newly bought shoes, you take a minute to get your balance. High heeled dress shoes are probably one of the stupidest inventions that mankind ever made. As you stand fully erect, you wobbled a bit, and put your arms out to the side to balance yourself. This changes the weight distribution of your body again.

After three failed attempts to walk in the things. You realize what your problem was, you are trying to walk like a man. Feeling stupid, you give it another shot, and sway your hips a bit as you walk. Heel, toe, heel, toe. And much to your disappointment it works. If you practiced long enough, you'd probably look elegant moving in these. However, you don't care enough to practice anymore.

Next step is deciding what to do about your ankles, they're hairy. But you shaving really seems more of a hassle than it's worth. Initially, you decide to wear long socks, as you pull them up to the midpoint of your calf muscle. But as you look down at them, you realize that they look stupid. Even you wouldn't be seen wearing these things with your heels.

You decide it'll probably be easier to go unshaven, since no guy is going to focus on your legs.

After stealing some of Tom's gel to keep your hair from going all over the place, you decide that you look presentable enough to call Dale.
Looking at his number, you take a deep breath and phone the guy.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Getting Dressed

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
The phone rings twice, and Dale picks up.
"Hello?" he says.
"Hi, Did you get my message?"
"Hi Alex...It is Alex right? Ya, I got the tickets."
"Oh, that's awesome! How much do I owe you for the tickets."
"Don't worry about it. I'm paying for tonight. So are we meeting up, or do you want me to send a cab in front of your house?"
"We'll meet up at the gym doors, if that's okay with you."
"Sure, that's fine. I'll be there just before eight."
"Can't wait." you say before hanging up.

Wow, pretending to be excited was easier than you thought. You strut up to the mirror and straighten your breasts. Manipulation comes easier to you in this body.

All you do now is wait until seven thirty, then you can make your way across campus.
Eventually, the time comes, and you decide to head out. But will you walk or take a cab? It's getting dark and cloudy out, plus your heels might not appreciate the long walk. However, you also have no pockets, and can't bring yourself to find some sort of temporary purse, so you couldn't carry much money on you anyways.

What do you do?
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Calling Dale

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
Taxis are expensive, and you might need some of that money later. It does look like it's going to rain, but the dance isn't more than a fifteen minute walk for you, (well, maybe a half hour in heels,) you should be fine.

Walking out, the wind blows fast, you're surprised as the speed the dark clouds are coming in. You see others quickly hail down taxi cabs or speed up to get to some shelter.

You should still be fine though, if you cut through a little used path through a bunch of trees on campus, you could save about five minutes. Speeding up your walk, you can smell the change in the air, something big is about to happen. You enter the shortcut, and make your way in for about two minutes before you realize how dark it has gotten. The streetlights turn on in the distance, but there are none here, and your eyes haven't adapted yet to the low lighting.

Suddenly you feel a hand on you shoulder.
You let out a little yelp, as you turn around. There is a tall dark man, at least six foot eight, looking over you. "In a hurry?" he says.

Your intuition is going into overdrive, you shouldn't be here, not like this, and there is something very off about the man.
"I'm going to the dance." you say.
"It's going to rain before we get there. You can share my umbrella." he says in a sinister voice.
"I'm fine, I have to go." you say, trying not to trip on your heels as you back away.
"I'm only trying to help." says the guy, grabbing your wrist.
Your heart is racing, adrenalin pumping. "I'll scream if you don't let go." you manage to say in a calm voice.
"You won't." says the man, as he leans in giving you a better look at his face.

You open your mouth to scream, but nothing comes out. His eyes, they hypnotize you.
"If you open your mouth again like that around me, you'd better be on your knees." says the dark stranger.

There is a thunder clap in the distance, and you swear, that this man's eyes are glowing.
"I like a silent woman." he says whispering in your ear.
You feel paralyzed in this guys presence, unable to move any of your limbs.
The guy holds your hair, and sniffs it, and in his creepy voice, he says, "you're hideous, I like that."
You're body tries to move, but all you can do is shake, the harder you push yourself, the more you quiver.
Rain starts to fall.
"You are quivering. Is it in anticipation?" asks the man.

You try and say no, you want to say no, you want to kick this guy in the balls and run.
"Yes!" you manage to say.
(NO, NO, NO, NO! WHY CAN'T YOU SAY NO?!)
"It was a rhetorical question says the shadow covered stranger. "Good girls don't talk, especially when they don't mean what they say."
"Sorry!" you body forces itself to say, and the worst part was, you voice now sounded sincere.
"WHAT DID I JUST TELL YOU?!" says the stranger with an angry laugh.
"What can I do to shut you up? What can I do to shut you up? What will put you in your place." the man says to himself.
"I know, even the mouthiest girls can't talk back when their mouths are full." he says with a shadowed smile.
"To your knees!" he commands, and an otherworldly force seems to pull your kneecaps to the ground.
The stranger is standing about a foot away from you, you're about waste high, and he begins to unbuckle his belt.
"Now scream." he commands.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: The Dark Stranger

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
Feeling humiliated, terrified, who knows what else, you are kneeling powerless to this Dark Stranger who appeared out of nowhere. Didn't Alice or Brian mention a Dark Stranger. Your mind is racing and you just can't think straight. As your mouth stays open, you try and try to scream, but you can't let out a sound.

At this point, the stranger has unbuckled his belt, and is unzipping his pants. Feeling your open mouth getting dry, you realize that you are able to blink your eyes, and even open and close them are your own will. Realizing you can do nothing about what happens next, you shut your eyes, not wanting to see what is coming.

Feeling terrified as your mouth starts to do sucking motions on its own, you tell yourself that you did everything in your power to stop this and brace yourself for the worst.

Suddenly, you hear a branch crack.
"Ow, dammit." say a voice behind the stranger.
That voice, it is a familiar one. You open your eyes, to see Tom coming towards you.
That's right, Tom uses this path a lot too.
"Stupid branches." says Tom as we wanders towards you and the stranger.
"Whoa, did I stumble across something here?" says Tom half joking, half cautious.
"Leave." says the stranger in a voice that sounds almost demonic. The stranger refuses to take his eyes off of you, his spell is unbroken, your lips are still making sucking motions, you must look like a fish, it's humiliating.
"I intend to leave." says Tom, as he tries to walk past you.
"Ouch Dammit." says Tom as another branch hits him. The rain starts to come down harder.

It's dark, maybe too dark, you can barley make out Tom, only the strangers glowing eyes stand out to you in the darkness.
"Stop. TOM, PLEASE STOP!" you think.
And as if your plea is answered, Tom slips on some wet leaves and lands about two feet from you. He gets up.
"This is what I think it is, isn't it?" says Tom, you can't tell if he's joking or not.
"I said for you to leave." says the stranger.
"Hey, I know you." says Tom looking at you.
"Oh thank god." you think.
"You're the girl that wanted to meet Alex in our dorm. Jeez, I never knew Alex would be into a girl like you." he says.
"No, don't do this." you think. "Piece this situation together in your head."

You try and tell a story to Tom through your eyes, but you don't know how effective you are at that. Plus the darkness is not helping the matters.
"LEAVE!" says the stranger, facing his palm towards Tom.
"You know, you left some of your clothes at our place. Could you pick them up, I'm pretty sure Alex would be too lazy to return them to you. Plus, you know, if his girlfriend ever found out."
"Enough, you rock brained simpleton. My patience grows thin, you WILL leave us." the stranger says.
At this point, Tom's eyes have adjusted well enough to see the event. He can tell that the stranger's pants are undone, and that you are not acting naturally.

Your cheeks are starting to feel pain as you lips are still making sucking motions, and the bulge in the strangers pants has grown.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Next

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
"Why are you still here?" says the stranger, finally turning his head towards Tom.
"Because, I'm talking to the lady, and I'm not leaving until she says something." says Tom grabbing a broken branch off of the ground.
The stranger turns to you, you are still on your knees and they're getting sore.
"She wants you to leave too." says the stranger.
"HELP! TOM, SAVE ME! IT'S ALEX, I CAN'T BE HERE! I CAN'T DO THIS!" your thoughts race, but the dark power that made you fall to your knees is turning your head to it's side.
"TALK!" the stranger's voice echoes inside of your head.
Your mouth closes, and your jaw feels sore. Your lips tremble, you want to cry, you let the pain inside of your head try and force you to cry, you blink a lot crying to force your eyes to water.

You feel the dark man's power over you, fighting to get more ground.
"TOM! FOR GOD SAKES TOM STOP THIS MAN!" you try to say, but you just look at your friend silent for a moment.
You can feel the dark force enter your mouth, and soon your tongue and throat seem to move on their own.
"Go...Away!" you say is a low monotone voice.
"Are you sure about this, honey?" says Tom.
You look at the stranger, he looks at you, you look back at Tom.
"Yes." you say, as you feel like vomiting.

"Okay, but I've seen this sort of thing done before..." says Tom.
"YES! Tom is not leaving, he knows something is up!" you think.
"...Lady, you're doing this all wrong. You need to massage your guys area first, for full effect."

(Wait, NO! What is he doing?)

"What are you doing?" asks the stranger, confused.

"I took up your time, I just want to help you out. Believe it or not, I know what I'm doing." Tom says, before going into odd, and perverse details on the act. "I'm just surprised she doesn't know this." he finishes.

The stranger starts to shake, his whole body starts to shake, even his bulge is shaking. Either he's very annoyed at Tom, or very eager to try what Tom suggested.

You feel your head being forced to turn towards Tom, and you say: "This is my first time."
"Oh, so Alex wasn't a slut." says Tom, good to know. "You're not one yet." says the voice in the back of your head.
"PLEASE LET THIS STOP!" you think, wanting to cry.

Twenty excruciating seconds pass, than you look at your friend and are forced to say: "Go...Away...Tom!"

"You heard the woman, go!" shouts the dark stranger.
"Fine, I'm sorry, says Tom as he backs down the path into the darkness.

The second Tom goes out of site, the stranger looks directly into your eyes again. "Such pretty eyes." he says.
His invisible power makes you kneel up straight again, as his bulge grows bigger. You are now less than two inches away from him. You can feel your lips start to move in anticipation, doing that humiliating sucking motion, and your hands move up towards his waste and prepare to pull down his undergarments. As your hands get near to the shadowy figure, you feel a coldness emanating from his body.

Unable to stop yourself, you close your eyes, as your feminine hands are about to pull down his underwear band. The stranger sees you close your eyes, and smirks. "Keep them open." he says.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: failed hope

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
Before you are about to go through with the nightmarish act, you hear a big CRACK! And the stranger falls over on his side.
Standing above him is Tom, you look up at your hero, and the sucking motion that your mouth was making quickly comes to a stop.
"But how?" you ask.
"Just RUN!" says Tom as he quickly pulls you up off your knees and pushes you up the path. You quickly kick off your heels as you run up the path.
You hear a roar as the dark man jumps up off the ground and attacks Tom. Through the darkness and the rain, you can hear the two of them fighting in the bushes.

You want to help Tom, he saved you. But you don't know how much good you'd be in a fight, for all you know, the stranger's powers might just make you end up helping him. Plus you don't have the muscles you used to. But time is short, and Tom's fate might rest on the decision you make in the next two seconds.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: At the last minute

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
You want to help Tom, but realistically, you don't know how much good you'd be in a fight against the stranger. Not only are you a lot weaker than you used to be, but you're also somehow under the guys direct control. The best you can do is call for help. Running up to a payphone, you quickly dial 9-1.

You quickly dial 9-1.

Your hand stops before you can push the number 1 again.
"Why I can't I do this?" you cry.
Its that stupid dark energy the man has. It's preventing you from doing anything against him.
Terrified, you just keep running, at least you can do that.
So people look through their car windows at the pathetic site of you running in the rain, shoeless in your dress. The ground hurts your feet. Which are a lot more sensitive that you're used to.

Ten minutes goes by, and you're a lot more exhausted than you should me. You sit in the dark on a bench, and hope that you've gotten enough distance from the stranger that you're safe from him. You hope that Tom is alright.

A voice behind you makes you give up hope.

"Good little girls don't run." says a creepy voice behind you.
As your about to get up to run, the voice says "don't bother."

Feeling that dark pull keeping you seated, your hands become folded on your lap as something makes you sit up straight.
"You're pathetic. You're not pretty, you're not obedient, you're not smart, and your not my time."
"Good. Now go away." you think.
"It may take some time, but I can't break you." says the guy.
"Take my hand." he says.
Against your will, your hand slowly comes up and reaches out towards the stranger.
He grabs it, and your mind is flooded with a ton of images that flash in front of you. You see all of the woman that man has had through history, you see of all the corpses left behind. You see Tom's corpse, and you see how you're going to die as an old woman by this monster's hands.

You end up trapped in an isolated country house for the remainder of your life, with no free will, no outside friends, and almost no control over your own body. Your mind is a prison of your new reality, and when your death finally comes, you're more than ready for it. Maybe you'll meet Tom in the afterlife.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Run!

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
Girl or not, you're going to go back and help Tom. You owe it to the guy.

Tom is losing the fight, as the Dark Man is tossing him through the wooded area. Tom is being tossed like a rag doll. "Stop" you yell as you throw a rock at the stranger. Unfortunately, the rock hadn't been thrown hard enough to give them the momentum you needed you knock the guy out. (You are so going to the gym if you survive this.)
The Dark Man looks at you, and Tom falls to the ground, seemingly knocked out.
"Come to me mistress." the stranger says as he holds out his left palm at you.

Unable to control yourself, you walk slowly towards this man who has nearly full control over you. If it wasn't so dark, and forced, your slow movement towards him would have looked hauntingly sexy.

But as you are about to meet your horrible fate, a small miracle happens, and you trip over the heeled shoe you tossed earlier. As you fall face first into the mud, covering the front of your dress with leaves. As you get up, with a splitting pain in your head, the first thing you see in front of you is the other heel you tried to abandon. You grab it as you get up off the ground. (Bless these things, they're so good at tripping you up! They're the greatest invention ever made!)

As you look up, you see that the dark stranger is standing in front of you with no pants. He must have lost them in the fight. At least he has his underwear on.

"Where were we?" he says with a hauntingly vicious smile.
Before you can get up, Tom attacks him from the side, and keeps punching him as hard as he can into the ground. Unfortunately, the stranger gets up and throws Tom to the other side of the path, where you hear him hit dozens of branches as he falls.

Before the dark man can look you in the eye again, you're swinging the heeled part of your shoe at the man, and as luck would have it, you hit him directly in the center of his forehead. The shoe stays put, as the mans eyes cross, trying to look up at the damage. A black substance leaks out, and the man falls backwards on the ground.

Kicking the stranger in the testicles, (which feels very weird and dirty when you don't have shoes on,) you leave the piece of trash as you go to see if Tom is alright.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Fight!

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
The tears finally start flowing down your eyes as you run towards Tom. You're thinking about what you just did, what you were about to do, what you couldn't do, and what may have happened to Tom.

"Tom! Tom!." you scream.
You see Tom laying in the ground, his head just inches away from a large tree trunk. he missed it by centimeters.
"Tom! Wake up Tom! Are you okay."
"Hey pretty girl." says Tom in a drowsy state.
"We need to get you out of here." you tell him.
"No!...We need to make sure that...guy is not a threat." he manages to say, before he closes his eyes and drops his head down on the ground again.
"Come on Tom." we've got to get you out of her." you say, trying hard to pick the guy up.

After about a minute of trying, Tom gets enough of his senses back that he begins to stand up again. Holding up one of his shoulders, you direct him towards where the battle ended. You look down at the ground where the guy fell, and there is nothing but an impact mark, not even your shoe is there.
"We'd better go to the police or the hospital." you tell Tom.
"Police...there's nothing up here worth saving." says Tom, pointing to his skull with a smile.
"There's more about you worth saving than you think." you say.

Tom looks like he's about to say something funny, when out of the corner of his eye he sees something. "Look." he says pointing to something just meters off the path.

It's a pair of pants.
"We should probably, take it for evidence." you say.
"Leave it for the cops to get....No one is going to take a stray pair of pants." Tom says with a weary voice.
"Okay, you have to sit down now." you say, gently placing him on the ground and you grab a cellphone from Tom's pocket and call for emergency services.

"They'll be here in three minutes." you tell Tom.
"Thanks." says Tom.
"No, thank you." you say.

A moment passes.

"Tom, how did you know to attack?" you ask.
"You called me Tom...people never call me that unless it's something urgent." he says, rubbing his head.
"So even in the darkness, you knew it was me?" you ask.
"Not really...that dress threw me off. I just knew you needed serious help. I don't even know your name." he says still woozy from the fight.
"I'm Alex, I'm your roommate!" you tell him, still tearing up a bit.
"Huh, glad I helped you then." he says and you help hold his head up.
"Alex?" he says after another moment of silence.
"Ya?" you respond.
"Nice Rack." he tells you.

You're not sure if you should joke back, play down the comment or act offended, but in the distance, you hear some sirens coming towards you.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Check up on Tom

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
The next night, around dusk, you were alone in the dorm room. Besides the pants and one of your shoes, the cops were unable to find anything at the scene. To make matters worse, your stories didn't match. Tom told the cops everything as he saw it go down, you told them you couldn't remember anything. No matter how hard you wanted to tell them the truth, all you could tell them was that you couldn't remember anything. You were convinced the officer thought you were on drugs, but he said that mental blocks weren't unheard of in this sort of situation, and gave you his number in case you remembered anything.

This disturbed you, since you realized that the stranger was probably still alive and had some sort of hold over you. You couldn't get much sleep that night either. Between dreaming of the dark stranger, and worrying about Tom, there wasn't much to you could do to close your eyes. You looked in the mirror and saw that you had developed bags under your eyes. It shouldn't bother you, but it did, you didn't look attractive. (But you don't want to look attractive, right?)
