You had missed your chance to talk with Alice, disappointed Dale, and left Tom alone in the hospital overnight, so that the doctors could keep an eye on him. You felt guilty, and violated.

Even worse was the fact that you hadn't changed back into a man for the second day in a row. You spent the whole day in the room trying to work out what you'd do with your life.

Wondering if you should cut your hair short or not, you're interrupted by the sound of someone unlocking your door.
"Tom!" you shout as he walks in. You run up to him and give him a big hug.
"Easy. The doctors say I shouldn't have too much excitement for at least a week." he says, holding up a small bottle of pills.
"But you're going to be okay?" you ask worriedly.
"Ya, these are just painkillers. I'm going to be fine." says Tom, and you walk him towards his bed.

I have so many questions about what happened to you." says Tom as he examines your curves.
"Believe me, I wish I could answer them." you say.
"Did you want this to happen to you?"
"NO! No. Trust me, I don't want anything to do with these." you say holding up your breasts.
"What's the worst part." asks Tom.
The truth is, there are a lot of bad parts, it's complicated your relationship with Emily, you're becoming paranoid of every stranger you pass, you hate that you're starting to become more obsessed with your hygiene, and noticing men is throwing you off. Plus girls don't look at you the same way anymore.
"I miss being able to pee standing up." you tell him.
Tom laughs slightly.
"I'm so hungry." he says.
"I can make a sandwich, if you want." you say.
"Thanks." says Tom as he lays down on the bed.

As you walk towards what counts as a kitchen in your room, you get the feeling that Tom is taking a peek at your ass.

Inside, you find an old jar a mayonnaise, and spread it on some ham and salad. As you cut it and put it on the plate, you slowly take it back out to Tom, horrified when you realize that you had just offered to make a man a sandwich and not think twice about it.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Loose Ends

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
"There you go." you say, putting the sandwich beside his bed.
"Thanks." he says, and he looks at you with approval.
You walk back to your side of the room feeling dirty. Why did you make that sandwich for him? Was it because you were grateful for his help, or was it something more? You really don't want to think about it anymore, but you shudder at the fact that you might be giving this guy signals.

Then it hits you, Tom said "thanks," not "Thanks, man." Tom usually said "thanks man," whenever you gave him something. Was it that he no longer saw you as a man? As you pass the mirror, you can see why you'd be afraid of that.

No, you can't think of that. Above all else, Tom is a friend, and Tom wouldn't ruin a friendship by making a move on you.

You try and call Brian to see if he knew anything more about the dark stranger you met, but all you get is his answering machine.
Looking on the internet, you can find no description for any person, demon or god for what you saw. After about an hour, you give up and are about to call it a night.

"Alex?" Tom calls from across the room.
"Ya?" you ask.
"can you get the lights?" he says.
"Sure." you say as you walk up and turn off the switch.
"Thanks man."


That last statement was reassuring enough to relieve enough stress to let you go to sleep.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Not over yet

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
Closing you eyes, you give into the darkness, as you dream you're playing soccer with Tom. You're the goalie, and male. Tom keeps kicking balls towards your net, but you keep stopping them.

All of a sudden, you think you see the dark man out of the corner of your eye. As you look for him, Tom scores on you.
"All right." shouts dream Tom.

All of a sudden, beside you, the dark stranger is clapping. "Very nice." I can see why you like him." he says.
"I like him as a friend." you say.
"Sure you do. But he won't like you back, just as a friend." he tells you. "Between straight boys and girls, sex always gets in the way of friendship."
"But we're both straight men." you argue.
"Indeed, you're both straight." says the stranger as he disappears.
All of a sudden, you look down, you're still in your goalie outfit, but you're no longer male.
"I scored. Let's celebrate." says Tom as he walks over to you and picks you up.
You want to tell him to put you down, but you can't, he did save you, and when you look into his eyes, you can see how much fun he's having.
He twirls you around in the air, and the next thing you know, you're on a dance floor, doing some fast paced dance moves with the guy, twirling around in your poodle dress, and showing off your athletic legs to everyone. After the song ends, you are about to fall backwards from exhaustion, but find out that you're already sitting down on the chair, with some red girly drink in front of you.
As you look down at it, you see that you are carrying a makeup mirror and are examining your face through it. You're wearing thick crimson lipstick to match your nails. Your eyeshadow is also slightly red to match your rouge and earrings. As you put the mirror back in your red purse, you notice that you're wearing a little red dress, that is showing off your breasts in with help from a red push up bra.

There is a smile across your face as you look at Tom.
"Alex, don't worry about the make up, trust me, you look perfect." he says, as you feel your legs rub against his under the table. It takes you a second, but you realize that you're the one doing the rubbing.
"To hell with waiting." you say as ypu both stand up in the restaurant and start making out.

You wake up with the feeling that you should really run towards the toilet.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: The nightmarish dream

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
Instead of rushing to the toilet, you ignore the pressure of your internal fluids and get out of bed, walking towards Tom.

It's currently 1am, and Tom is asleep, you slowly walk towards his bed, in the darkness.
"What am I doing?" you think.
You slowly, go up to his bed, being very quiet and graceful as you seem to glide towards your friend.
You kneel down beside the bed and whisper. "Are you awake?"
"Am now, what's up?" asks Tom.
"I can't sleep, I keep thinking about what happened last night." you say.
"Ya, I know, it was terrifying." Tom says, with his eyes closed, but still seeming concerned.
"Maybe I just need to get this off me chest." you think, still not in complete control of what you're saying. (Maybe you're just exhausted.)
"I honestly can't think of what would happen if you didn't come along." you say.
"The guy would probably av ...gd...you." says Tom fading out again.
"That's why I can't sleep, having a body like this is so...so...hard." you say.
"It's something you'll have to learn to deal with." Tom answered.
"But that's why I can't sleep..." you say. "I want to thank you with it."

Suddenly, your mouth starts making those sucking movements.
"Not really that funny." Tom says.
You start licking your lips and making slurping sounds and you slowly crawl down the side of Tom's bed.
"I said it wasn't funny Alex."
"What am I doing? This is wrong! Stop!" you think as you start to lift the covers.
"Jesus." says Tom pulling the covers away from you and wrapping them around himself.
"You're not joking." he gasps as he jumps up on the bed.

"Judging what I saw under there, you don't want me too be...just...joking." you say in a seductive voice.
"STOP ME TOM!" you think.
"Dude, I will punch you." says Tom.
"DO IT! PUNCH ME HARD! TIE ME UP!" you think. You're not sure if your body is getting aroused by those thoughts.
"You can't hit a girl. Especially not one that wants you." you say, crawling across his bed while licking your lips.
"You're not Alex! What have you done with Alex?!" Tom shouts as he circles to the other side of the room.
"You can call me Alex, you can call me sexy, you can call me lover, or even bitch! For you, handsome, I'll be whoever you want."
"Just for the record, this is SOOO wrong man." he says.

On hearing the word man, you slowed down, if just for a second. You then pounce, on Tom, as you try and tear off the sheets around his waste.
But as you land, Tom flips the light switch on as he bangs himself against the wall.

Once the light goes on, you regain most your control.
"Holy crap! Are you okay?" you ask sincerely.
"Just stay away from me!" shouts.
"No, I'm me again! I mean I've got my self control again! It was the darkness!" you promise him.
"You expect me to believe that BS about darkness?" he asks rubbing his head.
"Look at me! It's not the strangest explanation I've given this week!" you say pointing to your breasts and underwear. In the light, you realize that you're topless, and there is a wet stain on the bottom of your briefs.
"What happened to you?" Tom says in disgust.
"I...I don't know." you say breaking down.

Is this what you're destined to become? A sex-craved slut with little self control? You don't know if you could live with yourself. You don't know if being intimate with others would alter them as well. You feel unsure, weak, and in the back of your mind, you hear the stranger's laughter.

Crying on the floor, you see that one of the knifes in the kitchen had fallen during your episode. You look at it, at your wrists, and at Tom's underwear. You go back to looking at the knife and your wrists. Finally, more tears bust through, as the second wave of your emotional breakdown hits.

"Hold me Tom! Hold me!" you sob.
Tom does, and for a moment, you feel comforted being held in his arms. For a second, you don't know if it's the curse's doing or your own. But a moment later is when you realize, you can no longer tell where the curse ends and you begin.

You cry harder, as your toes begin to rub against Tom.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: The real nightmare

choices: No. You need to talk to Alice now!
Sure, you wouldn't have gotten this far without Dale anyways. have the dance.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
You decide that you should probably play it safe and take a cab. The long walk in those heels would probably blister them up. (Besides, a pretty little thing like yourself should be out alone when it gets dark.)
Sticking a twenty dollar bill in the bottom of your shoe, you walk out into the street, and flag down the next taxi coming towards you.
Jumping into the cab, you barely manage to sit down in the back seat, when another girl jumps in with you.
"Do you mind if I jump in?" she asks.
Not thinking, you say "no." assuming that she is going to the dance as well. (For once, your assumption is right.)
"To the dance." says the girl.
The cab starts to go, and some light rain starts to fall and hit the front window of the cab.

"Thanks for letting me come with you. This rain would have messed up my face, and I only spent an hour working on it." says the girl looking for a compliment.
"You look very pretty." you say.
"Why thank you!" says the girl. "You don't look to bad yourself."

The girl looks at you, and you can feel her eyes scanning you over. She's probably noticing that you aren't made up like she is.
"I'm penny." says the girl, holding out her manicured hand to shake yours.
"Nice to meet you. I'm Alex." you say.
"Poor dear, her parents probably wanted a boy."
"What?!" you say.
"I didn't say anything." says Penny, looking surprised that you barked at her like that. (It was probably just your imagination.)

Before the conversation can go any further, the cab stops in front of the building, where some of the guys are taking a smoke break.
"Thanks." says Penny, as she throws a ten at the cab driver, and gets out of the door.
You both start running before the rain gets worse, although to move at a much slower pace, as you still aren't used to your footwear.

"Over here." says Dale, at the dance entrance.
"Hi." you say.
"Wow, you look beautiful." says Dale. You figure he probably doesn't mean it, since he's eying Penny as he says it to you.
"You don't really mean that." you say.
"Just take the damn compliment woman." says Dale with a sleazy smile.
"I've got two tickets." says Dale to the guy at the door.

Dale pulls you into the gym, where a nice quick beat is thumping.
"Can I get you something to drink?" asks Dale.
"Maybe later." you say as you look the crowded room for Alice/Alan.

Suddenly, you see Alan standing at the corner, he makes eye contact with you, but before you can go, the song stops, and a slower beat starts up.
"May I have this dance?" asks Dale.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Arriving at the dance

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
"Sorry. There's someone I need to talk to first." you say.
"Bitch."
"What?!" you ask.
"I said, okay, go ahead." says Dale with a voice that sounds a little cold, angry and disappointed.
Dale goes off to stand in the corner, while you make your way through the dancing couples to get to Alan.

"I'm here. Now tell me what I want to know." you say.
"Hey, you made it. Congratulations Alex. You look hideous by the way." says Alan.
"Just tell me what I need to know." you say in a hostile voice.
"Well, I told you that I'd tell you when you got here, and I am a man of my word. Oh, I got my manhood back, if you were wondering." says Alan.
"That's super."
"Jealous?"
"Just tell me what I want to know."

All of a sudden, the song changed to another slow one.
"Oh, I love this song. Have this dance with me."
"But I had to come here with someone else." you protest
"It's dark enough in here, the guy will never see us."
(Wow, this guy has got you by the balls, and he knows it.)

With a sigh of defeat, you feel another part of your remaining manhood slip away, as you put your arms around his neck. You start to dance, and there is about a foot of air between you.
"You know, I fated my first dance. The first time I had to wear heels. The first time I felt compelled to do my hair in a bun. Some guys would love it, but not me." Alan begins to keep talking, telling about the hardships he's been through, and trying to look heroic for getting by. You tune him out, and keep looking down at your ankles, that are wobbling in your stupid shoes. You trip, but Alan just tightens the grip on you before you can fall.

"I hated when that happened." Alan says.
"I don't want to sound rude, but please can you just tell me how to get rid of this curse?" you ask.
"Apologizing for something that you shouldn't have to apologize for? I hated that. Has your mind started to tell you what others are thinking but not saying."
You look at a hot girl dancing with some guy beside you. She makes eye contact, and you hear her think "she looks like a man." Looking back at Alan, you say "yes."

"It only gets worse from there. If you don't transfer this curse soon, you'll start having erotic dreams and fantasies and the guys around you."
"Ew. Please just tell me how to get rid of this curse."
"You can't destroy the curse, or beat it, you just have to transfer it."
"Transfer, how?"
"Just kiss them."
"That's it?"
"No, you have to make sure that you have no feelings for the person you are kissing."
"Because I don't want to do to them, what you did to me?"
"No, because it doesn't work, and they might get turned on."
"Is that part of the curse?"
"Probably, or hormones, take pick your poison."

Then the song stopped.
"Well, I'm going to let you get back you your date." says Alan as he points at Dale.
"It's not a date!" you protest.
"Tell him that." says Alan, as Dale pops a breath mint in his mouth.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: One Last Dance With Alice...er...Alan.

choices: One of the single guys at the dance
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
"Talk to your friend?" Dale asks.
"Yup, we got it all sorted out." you say.
Alan disappears into the crowd of people, it's the last time you'll ever see him.
You look around the gym, and see a bunch of strange guys standing by themselves, you could pass the curse to them and never have to bother yourself with the results.
"Are you okay?" asks Dale.
"Ya, I'm doing great. I'm just thinking about---girly things." you lie.
"Don't tell me about it then." says Dale.

You both stand around awkwardly for a minute. You see that Dale is eying Penny, who is hopping around in a large group of people.
"This is stupid." you think. "I can't live like this, but do I really want to be responsible for someone else having to deal with what I've gone through?" You stare at Penny. She's gorgeous, but you're not attracted to her. You should be but you're not. You're kind of envious of her looks. (STOP IT!)

You think of what Emily would do if you weren't with her. She'd probably end up with another man, and you can't let that happen. (She might start dating Tom!)

Just then, it was decided, you're passing this curse on to someone else. But who?
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Passing the curse

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
You look at Dale, and blink your eyes. It's something that you didn't notice, but now that you think about it, you've been blinking a lot more often than usual ever since you've transformed. (Apparently girls blink more than guys, maybe it's because their longer eyelashes are heavier.)
You let out a petite cough, to get Dale's attention.

"Oh, would you like to dance?" asks Dale.
"Sure, if you want to." you say.

The two of you go out and start dancing, and you quickly come to the realization that you suck as dancing as a woman. Your movements are too stiff, and you make clunky fast movements, like you were an action figure. You close your eyes and slowly try and sway, you're not bad at it, but calling you good would be an overstatement. Finally, the song ends, and another slower one comes on.

Most the people around you pair up with the closet person of the opposite sex, and you walk up to Dale. Neither of you say anything, you put your arms around his neck, he puts his around his waste. You try and leave enough distance between you so that your crotches aren't touching.
This goes on for about a minute before Dale finally calls you out on it.
"Are you alright Alex? You really don't seem to be into this tonight." says Dale.
You think for a bit about how to respond. "I'm sorry, this is my first dance. I don't really know what I'm supposed to be doing." you say.
"No there's more than that." Dale replies in the soft voice.
"I'm sorry, I just couldn't make up my mind." you say.
"To do this..." you say just before you push yourself up to his lips and kiss him.
The kiss lasts for ten seconds, and each of you feels the tip of the others tongue part through the pressed lips.
"I'm sorry." you say as you push yourself away from him and disappear into the darkness of the dance.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Dale

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
You run outside into the rain and jump into an idling taxi.
Taking out the money in your shoe, you tell the taxi to bring you to your dorm.
You feel wrong for what you just did, but Dale did have this sleazy vibe to him, chances are he was just trying to get into your pants, (or dress, if you want to be accurate,) leaving him like that was the only straight thing to do.

Getting to your apartment, you realize that you forgot to take your key. You patiently wait for about twenty minutes outside in the rain, before some drunk guys comes towards you and says "what's the matter? Were you stood up?"
Realizing this is your chance to get out of the rain you play along.
"YES! And now I'm STRANDED out here, in this dress, getting wet, with no key to my room." you say with a fake amount of stress in your voice. The rain on your cheeks mimic tears.

"Hold on. I'll let you in darling." says the drunk guy.
"Thanks. I appreciate it." you say, leaning in and whispering that last part right in his ear. The building's door opens, and you walk up towards you room. To your surprise, the door is unlocked. You open it up to find a Tom moving around with some girl on his bed.

"Whoa. Jeeze!" yells Tom is surprise as he sees you walk in. "What!" yells the girl. (Holy, crap, that's Emily's voice!)
"What the hell are you doing here?" asks Tom as he pulls the blanket around his waist and stands up to walk towards you.
As thankful as you are that Tom is covering his privates, in his rush to get up, her forgot to leave anything on the bed for the girl to cover herself up with. This leaves you with a clear look at Emily naked on your roommate's bed sheet.

You're about to chew them both out, when you realize that neither of them recognize you. Tom must have a hard time telling who you are, now that you're all dressed up. You're the stranger here.
"I'm sorry, I think I walked into the wrong room." you say, and slam the door shut. Running down the hall, you trip on your stupid heal and fall. Feeling pain, you expect tears to flow down your face, but you soon realize that they were flowing from the minute you saw Tom and Emily together.

Beaten, and wounded, you hobble towards the only safe place you can think of for tonight, the janitor's closet. Located on the main floor of your building. You lock the door from the inside, and lay down to cry. This explains why Emily seemed so distant over the last week, and why Tom was almost never around. They were cheating on you behind your back.

You eventually cry until you have no more energy to cry, and pass out from exhaustion.
You wake up to a light passed it's way through a window and onto you through the open door. As the warmth of the sun moves its way over you, you feel your body slowly changing, until your chest is as flat as a pancake and there is a bulge sticking out of your waste area. You feel the dried drool on the side of your mouth as your eye's adjust to see that the janitor is taking a picture of you with his cellphone camera. Feeling a draft you realize that your still in the dress. At least you're male again.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: It worked

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
The picture makes you infamous for the next few days as a party animal, an no surprise, Emily uses the picture as an excuse to break up with you. Tom admits to cheating on Emily, but claims that you shouldn't mind, because he kept seeing that one girl over at the apartment this last week.

The most awkward thing about this week was that Dale called you several times, leaving some odd messages:

-*beep* "Alex, this is Dale, last night, what was that all about? I'm not saying it was bad, I'm just saying I didn't get why you'd kiss and run like that." *End Message. -beep*

-*beep* Alex, seriously, we have to talk, do you have some disease that I should know about? I saw the picture of that guy wearing your dress. We need to talk. *End Message. -beep*

-*beep* "Geez, what's happening, I know you know something." (voice cracks) "It's not funny. We have to meet." -*End Messages*

Finally, you caught Dale when he calls you a week later.
"Hello?" you say.
"Hi, is Alexandra there please?" says a woman on the other line.
"I'm sorry, there is no one buy that name here. Are you sure you have the right number?"
"I'm positive." says the voice.
"I'm sorry, I can't help you." you say before hanging up.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Epilogue

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
You run out of the gym, but slip in a puddle and fall in the rain. You look around, all of the smokers have gone inside to wait out this storm. Confused, hurt, and feeling a little bit guilty, you break down and cry. You sob for about thirty seconds, before you feel a hand on your shoulder.
"Now what was that about?" Dale says in a gentle and calculated voice.
"I don't know. I'm so confused. you say as you try and get up. You fail, and fall back down again.
"Let me help." says Dale as he picks you up and carries you inside. You had no idea he was this strong.
Placing you down on the bench you look into his eyes.
"I want you so hard!"
"Excuse me?!" you say.
"I said, I'm going to go get someone to look at your ankle." says Dale.
"Oh." you say embarrassed as Dale gives you a confused look.

Dale leaves, and you look at your arms, and legs. "It didn't work." you think. You don't feel any difference, and you're in a light area, shouldn't the change start happening soon?

No. No it shouldn't. You didn't immediately change, it would stand to reason that you wouldn't immediately change back.

Ten minutes pass, and Dale comes back with someone, who claims to be a medical student. "It's just some bruising." the guy says, put some ice on it and it'll be fine.

"I think we should should call this evening short." you say.
"Because of the pain?"
"Because of the pain."
"Sure, just one thing before we go." says Dale, as he puts his fingers on your chin.
Before you can even think of doing anything, Dale's puckered lips press against yours. And about after five seconds of starting to struggle, something kicks in in your brain, and you just go with it.
"What was that for?" you ask, trying to act defensive.
"To keep your mind off the pain." says Dale.
Dale then leaves to call a taxi, and pays for your ride back.

The next morning you wake up in your bed, hiding under the covers as Tom snores on the other side of the apartment.
Noticing that you haven't changed back, you realize the reason why your body didn't transfer the curse; you had feelings for Dale. You shudder as images of the erotic dream you had last night start to come back to you. (Oh please let it just be a dream!)

Even if you manage to pass the curse after this, you'll never be able to look your reflection in the eye again. Sore, sweaty, and humiliated, you accept defeat for today, as feelings for the relationship you had with Emily start to fade from your mind.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: It didn't work

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
Looking at the people dancing in a crowd, you figure this might be a good chance to rub up against a stranger and let him steal a kiss from you.
"I want to go dance with that crowd." you tell Dale.
"Fine, but next slow song, you're mine." Dale tells you. (Better hurry and get this over with.)

You start to squeeze into the crowd and start jumping along with the music, you can feel some guys purposely bumping against your ass. The group was tighter than you expected, as everyone keeps jumping up and down. You feel a squeeze on your ass, and turn around to give the guy a piece of your mind, but once you see the culprit, you're surprised that it's Penny.
"Let's show these guys, what we got." she says taking your hand. The next two minutes are a blur, and once the song is over you both hold your knees, exhausted.
"Um, Alex, you should look down." smiles Penny.
Your eye's wander down to see that one of your breasts has popped out of the dress. Instinctively, you adjust your dress and cover up the exposed nipple.
"You'll be popular tonight." says Penny.
"It's not the type of popularity, I want to be known for." you say.
"Oh honey, have some fun tonight."

Penny spends the next song, trying to get guys to notice her, but most the guys refuse, her advances. You can't figure out why, she seems pretty enough. Once a random guy comes up and starts trying to dance with you, you see Penny walk off out of the gym. This is your chance you think, looking at the athletic guy in front of you, who is more than a bit drunk. However, you can't help feeling bad for Penny, maybe you should go see what's up.

What do you do?
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: One of the single guys at the dance

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
As much as you feel like helping Penny out, you have your own priorities. You are currently in a dress and heels surrounded by men who had just seen your left breast; you need to make things better before they start to get worse. Bumping and grinding those around you on the dance floor, you finally managed to to get this drunk guy right in front of you, and you're not going to screw this up.
"Sup." He yells, speaking over the music. You ignore his words and keep dancing.
"You wanna make out?"
"What?" you respond.
"I said that you're a good dancer." shouts the guy.
"You're sweet." you say.
"I can't hear you! You're going to have to lean closer." says the guy.
"I said thank you!" you repeat.
"What?" asks the guy with a smile.
"I said..." but before you could finish your sentence, the drunk guy leans in and grabs you, pulling you towards his mouth.

The kiss (if you can call it that) lasts less than three seconds before one of the guy's friends pulls him off of you, and drags him away.
"I'm so sorry." said another of the friends.
"Just get him out of here." you say without thinking.
"I'm so sorry." You're not going to lay charges are you?" asks the friend.
"I don't know, just go.: you say, wiping the guys drool of the side of your lips. You can taste the alcohol.

You hear some of the girls talking about you, you don't know if they're really talking, of if your minds are playing tricks on you. Two of them offer to take you to the bathroom, but you stop them as they try and pull you out of the gym once you get to Dale.
"What happened?" asked Dale, seeing that you had become the center of attention.
"Something...Look, I don't want to talk about it, I'm just going home. Sorry about tonight." you say.
"That's okay, we'll make up for it later." says Dale as you exit the dance.

You're feeling confused, violated, you wanted to get rid of the curse, but weren't expecting the guy to kiss you without leading him on. It made you feel humiliated, vulnerable, like a weak little girl. You mind floods with strange thoughts as you walk outside.

As you walk outside in the rain, you hear the sound of someone repeatedly getting punched in the stomach. Curiosity gets the better of you, as you see two guys beat up the drunk athlete that kissed you.

"Can I join?" you ask.
"Miss, you don't want to go down this road." says one of the jocks who was doing the punching.
"Dude, that's her." said the other.
"In that case..." says one of the jocks, holding the drunk guys arms behind his back to give you a clear shot.

"Hey, remember me?" you ask the drunk.
The drunk looks woozy, but you see that he recognizes you.
"Good, because for the next few days, you'll be in for a world of hurt." you say with a mildly threatening tone.

You follow this statement with a quick right knee to the man's balls.

"Let's see how you like being a woman." you say, as you try and confidently stride off into the night.
You trip on your heels and almost fall, during your attempt at the impressive exit.

In the taxi cab, you see the rain start to come down harder. But apparently, you did it, you got rid of the curse.

The next morning you woke up to find out that you were male again. You did it, you beat this thing.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: The unwanted connection

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
You're not sure why, but you feel compelled to follow Penny. Making a quick exit from the gym, you follow Penny from a distance, until you see her go into the girls bathroom. Following her, you stop the second you get to the door. Something about going into the girls' room still feels wrong. Still, you close your eyes and push open the door. (Is it just you, or have doors gotten heavier recently?)

Inside, you hear a quiet sobbing from the middle stall.
"Penny?" you ask.
"Go away." Penny says.
"I can't do that. I need to make sure you're okay."
"No you don't, go away!" Penny repeats.
"I can't leave you like this, it'd ruin my night, which believe me, has been pretty awkward."
"Please...Just..." Penny says before sobbing.
"Are you PMSing?" you ask.

There is a laugh from the stall, and the door becomes unlocked.
"Come in." says the voice.

Penny's once made up face is a mess, the tears have caused the make up on it to run or smudge.
"I worked so hard and so long." says Penny to herself. "I'm a freak! No one wants to dance with me."
"You're not a freak, believe me, I know something about being a freak. Plus you were only there for two, maybe three dances. It was early. Eventually some guy would ask you to dance."
"I spent so much money, and it's all been a waste."
"Trust me, I spent more money and time finding this dress than I ever intended to. And it didn't have the desired affect at all" you say. "It's all part of being a woman I guess."

Penny looks up at you. "You honestly can't tell." she says.
"Tell what?" you ask.
Penny grabs her chest. "These are fake." she says.
Just then, it suddenly clicks in your head what's up with Penny.
"But you're skin looked so smooth, and I didn't see any sign of facial hair."
"Hormone treatments."
"And down here?" you ask, pointing towards your own waist.
"Pre-Op" admits Penny. "But the guys can still tell, they can always tell. It's why I always go to these things alone."

(Well, it looks like fate finally gave you a break.)

"You know Penny, being female isn't all you think it is. It's not just playing dress up."
"I know." she says with a sob.
"You have to judge each stranger as a possible threat, you can't walk home alone most the time, other girls are totally bitchy to you behind your back, and only the strange guys seem attracted to you."
"I can live with that." Penny says.
"No, really, I think you should just stick to being a cross dresser. You'll find a wife that loves and understands you, plus you'll have all of the fun that girls have, with none of the baggage."
"It's not the same. You don't know how lucky you are." says Penny.
"If given the option, I'd rather be a father." you say.

(Wow, girl talk is hard, and awkward, especially, when no real girls are involved.)

You think for a second, you're guessing that Penny (if that is her real name) wouldn't mind being in the predicament that you're in, but at the same time, didn't either Brian or Alice mention something about transfer of masculine and feminine energy. Maybe Penny wouldn't have enough to return you to your previous state.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Penny's secret

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
"Penny, I can help you. But you have to close your eyes and trust me." you say.
"Okay." says Penny as she closes her eyes and pulls her face back. She probably thinks that you'll do something with her make-up. Instead, you learn towards her, and kiss her gently on the lips. (Her lips taste like red liquorish.) About a second later, Penny opens her eyes, and pushes her back against the toilet.
"What was that?" she asks.
"It was a gift." you say.
"But I don't like girls, this won't help me." she says, although you can see a bit of a bulge in her pants.
"Penny, please, you need to promise me two things. I know it sounds strange, but tomorrow, if you notice any changes, you need to not kiss anyone for a week, and after that, only make contact with guys you like."
"Why would I..."
"Just promise me!" you say.
"Fine." says Penny.
"Look, if you have any questions, call me." you say, after you grab Penny's lipstick and write your number on a piece of toilet paper.

You walk out of the bathroom, strutting confidently, and take a cab home.
Part of you feels bad for leaving Dale like that, with no explanation, but really, the only reason you went there was to try and get rid of this curse, and now you gave it to the only person that might benefit from it.

You go back to your dorm room, and spend the night hiding under the covers.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Just Kiss Penny

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
The next morning, you wake up to find that you're a male again. Your junk isn't as big as before, but at least you can pee standing up, which you go over to the toilet and do. Your skin still seems softer, than before, and your nipples poke out more than most guys do. You look into the mirror and see that your face has changed a bit, but still looks more fragile than it did before Alice kissed you.

Also, you're hair is a lot longer.
No problem, you can go get it cut once you get some more money.

It's week later, and it dawns on you that you'll probably be stuck like this. Nothing is major enough to completely change your life, but interactions with Emily seem to be a bit rough.

One day out of nowhere, Penny calls you on the phone, says "thank you." then hangs up.
Well, at least someone ended up happier from this whole experience.

You don't even think about it until about a month later at a party, when Tom introduces everyone to the new girl he's dating, who looks an awful lot like a curvier version of Penny. Thankfully, she doesn't recognize you.

"That could have been me." you think, before slapping yourself, and going back to focusing on your relationship with Emily.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: The Morning After

choices: Go and look for someone else
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
You don't really like Dale, but you wouldn't have been able to meet Alan here if it wasn't for him. Feeling like you owe him something, you decide that one dance wouldn't hurt. It is a slow dance, and seems to go on forever. You arms are around his neck, but you keep finding yourself leading. You can't help it, it's what you were used to.

Dale then looks at you. "You suck at this." he says.
"What am I doing wrong?" you say.
"Well, first your standing a mile away from me, if a stranger crouched down, he could walk between us. Second, you're leading."
"So it's no okay for a girl to lead?"
"No...It's fine, it's just weird...It just looks like you're not enjoying it. Here, I'll direct you."

But before Dale can pull you closer to him, the song ends and a more upbeat song starts.

"I'll show you next time." says Dale with a wink.

You look at Alan, who is still standing in the corner. (It's probably time you talked to him.)

"Enjoy that dance?" asks Alan with a smug look on his face.
"Not enough to immediately have another one." you say.
"Get used to it. I lost track of the number of times I did something like that."
"But you didn't have to." you say.
"First week, no, but you didn't have to get that dress, did you?"

You look down and see that you are in the blue dress. For a second you forgot you were wearing it.

"You'll find your free will becoming more restricted as time goes on." says Alan.
"So how do I transfer the curse?" you ask.
"It's simple, just kiss someone." Dale says.
"That's it?" you ask.
"Just make sure it's not anyone you're attracted to or have feelings for."
"Why?" you say.
"Well, they won't get the curse, they'll just get more turned on. Trust me, it's not what you want to happen."
"And that's why you chose me? A stranger in the night."
"Yes. But I had to deal this this for about a month, after week three, I couldn't really help myself. You're transition should be almost immediate."
"Interesting." you say.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: First Dance of the Night/Talk with Alan

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
Without warning, you throw yourself at Alan and land a giant kiss right on the lips. Some girls are looking at you with disgust, seeing that you kissed someone else that you didn't come in with.

Alan pushes you hard, and you fall back against another girl.
"What's going on here?" says some Athletic guy who has come to sort the situation out.
"This man pushed me." you say.
"This woman came up and assaulted me for no reason." Alan says.
"You over there." says the athlete, pointing towards the corner.
"I'm going to have a talk with you." says the guy to Alan.

"You have no idea what you did." says Alan.

"What was that?!" asks Dale as he comes up to you. "Did you just kiss that guy."
You consider telling Dale the truth, but realize that that would be an awful idea no matter how you spun it.
You think about what most girls would do in this situation.
"I need to go to the ladies room." you tell Dale.
"Wait, tell me first what just happened!" says Dale, grabbing your arm.
"Please." you say with a pout.

Dale loosens his grip and you leave.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Kiss Alan

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
In the ladies room, you just look at the mirror and think. Some girl to the left of you is putting on her make up, and another is sitting down on the stall.

You have no idea what you're doing here. You kind of just want to go home, and you are about to when you hear a shriek coming from the hallway.
"No, no, no!" says a familiar voice.
A girl runs into the bathroom, and looks at the mirror.

"Fuck!"

The girl then looks over and sees you.
"Hello Alice." you say.

"No, dammit. Shit. Hell. Cunt." swears Alice.
"What's wrong?" you ask, being a total bitch about this situation.
"You! You did this! I was back to normal for less than a day, and then you had to ruin everything!"
Then you realized, she had changed faster than you ever did.
"Wait, how come you changed so fast?" you ask her.
"Because...I don't know why. Maybe the curse remembered it." she says. "Wait, why haven't you changed back."
"Something about a night god." you say, trying to remember what Brian had told you.
"This is bad." says Alice, examining herself in the mirror. "As far as I could tell, passing the curse was supposed to be a one time thing.
"What does that mean you say?"
"We'll see how we do in the morning." she tells you.
"So you're not going to scratch my eyes out?"
"In the morning." says Alice, just before sitting down on the floor, and starting to cry.

The woman to the left of you is finished touching up, and leaves, but not before staring at you to like you're psychos.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Alice Again

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
You wake up to find yourself in a strange apartment, you figure it has to be Alice's. Alice comes out with some hot coffee, and gives it to you.
"Here, you go honey, you'll need this, it's decaf." she says.
You look at Alice, something is very off about this, she's smiling, wearing earrings, and sporting a pink shirt and a thong. You can see her nipples through her shirt. "What's going on?" you ask, still groggy.

"You don't remember?" asks Alice.
"Remember what?" you say trying to hear the sound of your own voice.
"Oh, no. It happened again, didn't it? Another black out."

You are suddenly less groggy. "What?! Blackout?" you ask.
"You just remember being in the ladies room again." says Alice.
"Yes!" you say.
"Hold, on, I love this part!" says Alice. She opens up one of her compact mirrors and gently puts it in your hands.
Moving it around, you see yourself.
"Hey, I'm me again! The male me, I mean!" you say.
"Of course you are." says Alice, leaning against you, "and what a man you are!"

"What do you mean by that?" you ask.
"I mean you're my man." says Alice, as she holds up her hand, showing a wedding ring. You look at your left hand, and see a similar ring.
"Wait? What?!"

Alice looks sad that you're not happy.

"This is that damn curse!" you tell her.
"Honey, that was two years ago. And don't call it a curse, that's such a negative connotation, call it a spell."
"I have to go for a walk you say."
"I'll come with you." says Alice.

As you walk, you find that you have a cellphone in your pocket. You look at the menu, and find out that Brian's name is still on this thing.
You call him up as you're walking.
"Brian, this is Alex." you say.
"That time of the month again?" he asks.
"What?" you ask.
"You look your memory once every month, and call me with the same damn questions." he responds.
"Really?!" you say, half terrified, and half excited.
"Yes, you're married to Alice, yes, it's part of the curse, the more time goes by, the more docile she becomes. It's all part of the curse. It was supposed to make her find a good husband, and that series of events lead her to ending up with you."
"So how did the curse effect me?" you ask.
Alice has put her arm around your free one, and looks at you lovingly.

"Well, as far as I can tell, the blackouts are a glitch, whoever created this curse had no idea that it could ever turn in on itself."
"So, it's just the blackouts?" you ask.
"No, it's more than that. Most the time when I see you, you don't act like yourself. It's only around this time of the month when you seem to act like the person you were when we first met." Brian tells you.
"So..."
"So, I've been researching any and all possible explanations in my spare time. To help you out" he tells you.
"But...you're going to say but, since there is always a but."
"But...you seem happy most days. Most people who don't know how you met think you're the perfect couple." says Brian.
"You're freaking me out." you say.
"Oh, Amy says hi!" says Brian.
"Hi!" says Amy over the phone.
"Anyways, I've got to go. There is only so many times I can tell you the same thing before I got crazy." says Brian as he disconnects the call.

"Brian is so sweet." says Alice, as she pulls herself closer to you.
"He is." you say.
"It's getting cold. I'm going to head back." you say.
"That's a great idea. I know just how to warm you up." says Alice, and she puts her hand in your back pocket, and rubs herself up against you.

We'll, it's far from perfect, in fact, you later found out that Emily had dumped you for Tom shortly after that night at the dance. But you took comfort in knowing that this would only last until Brian found a cure, or you blacked out again.

Plus you at least got to wear the pants in the relationship.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: The Next Morning...well, maybe not the next

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
Walking through the crowd, you see some lonely guy pitying himself in the corner.
"Do you want to dance?" you ask him.
The guy looks up at you. "Me?" he asks nervously.
You nod your head and pull him out into the dance floor with you.
Thankfully, it's not a slow song, but the guy sucks are dancing more than you do. And at least you have the excuse that you're not in your proper body. Looking nervous, like he's going to accidentally offend someone, the guy keeps a good meter away from you at all times.
You really don't mind dancing with this loser, there is no way he's going to try and make a move on you.

As the song continues, you accidentally bump each-others behinds. "Sorry." he says in a pathetic tone. The guy is obviously not comfortable with his sexuality. Which some girls might find cute in early high school, but this is university. The song ends, and he walks back over to the corner. You decide to walk back with him.

"Want to give me another dance?" you ask.
"It's okay." says the guy looking at his feet.
"Want to talk for a bit?" you ask.
"Sure." he says in a sad voice.
"You don't look like you do this much." you say
"I don't." says the guy.
"But you're here. You must be here for a reason." you say.
"I'm here with my friends." says the guy.
You look around to see if you can spot anyone who is looking towards the man.
"Where are they?" you ask.
"Dancing." he says as he points towards a group of people having fun. One of the guys in the group beckons the person you're talking with to join them. The guy gives a hand signal, saying he's not interested.
"Do you want to impress them?" you say.
"What?" he asks.
"Do you want to impress your friends?" you repeat.
"How?" says the guy.
"Dance with me, and throw me around."
"I have no practice." he responds, twiddling his thumbs.
"Well, that makes two of us." you say, pulling him into the crowd again.

Another fast song starts.
"Put your hand on my waste." you tell the guy.
"What?!" The guy asks.
"Just press against it, I'll do all the work." you tell him.

For a short time, you start swaying your hips back and forth. You then raise your arms over your head as you swing your hair. You have no idea if this is sexy, but if a girl ever did this you you, you'd notice.
"Now move your hands up the side.: you tell him.
Meekly, the guy does as ordered.
"Too, high." you tell him as he nears your ribcage. "Go lower." you tell him as you sway a lot more.
As you heat the song about to reach it's end. You look him in there eyes, and say "Now catch me!"

You purposely trip on your heels and fall, right into him. Panicking, the guy reaches out to grab you. As you lean back, you look up and make eye contact with him. He unleashes a giant smile.
"Ya!" two of his friends say, and a few more of his buddies give him a small clap.

"Why did I just do that?" you think.

Looking around to make sure you can't see Dale, you force the little awkward guy to have the next slow dance with you.
"Thanks." he says, blushing.
"Hey, I just brought out what was in you. You just have to decide if you want to go with it, or go back to being a shrinking violet."
"I..." he says, but can't finish his sentence.
You pull yourself closer the the guy, making sure your breasts push up against him.

"Why am I doing this?" you think. Are you slowly losing control of yourself?
"It's cool, you're young, and there is so much potential in you." you say.
"Really?" says the guy, more embarrassed than anything else.
"Yes." you whisper in his ear in the most sexual tone that you could. You mind seems split into two parts, one is terrified, and the other is struggling not to laugh.

The current song is wrapping up, there are only a few chords left. You can feel the guy relax his grip on you.
"One more thing." you whisper to the guy.
"What?" he asks in earnest.
"This." you say, as you land a gentle kiss on his lips.
A moment, later, your mouths pull apart, and the song ends.
You take a step back.
"What was that?" asks the guy.
"Just the beginning." you answer as you drift off into the crowd.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: The dorkiest guy on the floor

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
You feel like you could control your movements, but you're not sure if you want to. Thinking faster makes you slow down, but not thinking about things makes you speed up. You can also drift left or right if you feel like it, but still you continue walking through the campus. It's strange, most the girls aren't looking at you, as you walk by. Maybe it's early, maybe they can't tell you apart from a real girl. One or two guys look at you as you pass by them, but even they don't look at you like they did in the pass few days. (But that's a good thing, right?)

Suddenly, it hits you were to are headed, this is the way to Brian's place. Why is your body walking here? Entering his building, you walk up the stairs until you get to his room. You knock three times and he answers. "Alex! he says in surprise. "I barely recognized you." he seems tired.
"What am I doing here?" you say in a dazed voice.
"I was going to ask you the same thing." he says.
You try to enter his apartment, you find that you're physically make yourself enter it.
"Come in." says Brian, seeing your struggle to enter his domain.
"Thanks." you try to say, but all you do is smile as you walk in. "That's weird." you think.
You both stare at each other, not knowing what to say.
"Want some coffee?" Brian finally says.
"Okay!" you say as he goes to get you a cup. You can't help but smile for some reason.
"Here." says Brian, giving you a mug of the black liquid.

WOW! That caffeine has a stronger kick than you're used to. Maybe your new body is reacting to it differently.

"So, why are you here?" asks Brian.
"I don't know."
"You honestly just walked here?"
"Yes!"
"Give me a second." Brian says as he goes to his desk, and brings back a book.

Flipping through the book, he stops on a strange page. "So, you walked here completely on instinct?" he says.
"Yes."
"And are, you, um...completely female?" he asks.
You look down at yourself, embarrassed. You grab the end of your hair, and stroke it a bit. "Physically." you manage to say.
"Interesting." says Brian as he flips the page. "Take a look at me, and tell me honestly, what is the first word you think of when you think of me?" asks Brian.
"Food, resource, information, friend, helpful, nerd." you think. "Man." you say.
"Interesting, for the first word that you use to describe me involves my sex." says Brian.
"No, it's gender issues...on my mind...makes sense." you spurt out, you're not thinking straight, Brian saying the word 'sex' threw you.
"Well, judging by you're responses, I'd say you're condition seems to have similar traits to that of lycanthropy of legend, except instead of gaining the physical and mental metamorphoses into a noble hunter, you're changes seem to be limited to that of the opposite sex." says Brian, doing his best to sound smart. (And it's kind of working.)
"Did you just call me a werewolf?" you say in a voice that comes out dizzier than you mean it to.
"No, more like a were-woman. Which if you know your Celtic wording, comes across as both humorous and accurate." Brian says with a chuckle.
You look at him, wondering what's so funny.
"The word 'were' means man in Celtic dialect." he says.
"That's not that funny." you say with a confused look on your face. (Are you playing dumb?)
"Sorry, back to business. Your changes, are gradual, while traditionally, were-wolfs are almost instantaneous, plus werewolves don't spend their entire time stuck in the same form, which you seem to be doing."
"Great." you say with a sarcastic sigh.
"One thing you should be grateful for is that you seem to be mostly in control of your actions. Traditionally, werewolves are driven almost completely by instinct and are less in control of themselves than natural wolves."
"So, you're saying, I'm going to attack those around me?"
"No. If you strip a wolf to his most basic instincts, than multiple them, you're left with a creature that's main drive is to hunt. If you strip a woman's instincts down to her most primal nature, what are you left with?" Brian asks.
"I don't know!" you say.
"Yes you do. What's the driving force of all humanity?" he asks you.
"To survive?" you answer.
"But eternal life is impossible. The best you can do is pass on your genetic code. The main instincts of any human is to find a worthy mate and breed." he says.
"But...I...Um..." you say, unable to think of a response.
"Not what you wanted to hear?" asks Brian with a bit of smugness about him.
"I don't even know anymore." you say with a depressing breath.
"Relax, it's probably not that bad, like I said, there seem to be differences between your condition and werewolf-isms." says Brian.
"Aren't werewolves contagious?" you ask.
"Yes. In the movies, but even there, the rules of infection spread. Is it their blood, saliva, mystical bite or a simple scratch that duplicates there curse? It changes from version to version. So don't scratch, bite, kiss, or fuck anyone, and you'll do fine."
"Don't what?!" you ask, insulted that Brian would even think of you doing something like that.
"Relax. I'm joking...Partially. You did after all, contract your current condition from someone who was in a similar state, right?"
"ALAN!" You say.
"Alan?" asks Brian.
"The guy who did this to me. Well, he was a she back then, and named Alice. He was a dude again when I saw him yesterday." you tell Brian.

The next ten minutes of the conversation involve you explaining to Brian almost everything that Alan told you.
"Interesting." says Brian.
"Isn't it?" you say.
"Listen, I might be able to work something out from what you told me, but I have to work fast. Come back here in four hours, you might not have to play Alan's game at the dance tonight."
"Really?!" you say, in a voice that produces so much excitement that is almost swoons.
"Give me four hours." says Brian.
"Four hours?"
"Four hours!"
"I'll be back in four." you say with a sexy little smile on your lips.

Brian seems to notice this as you walk towards the door.
"Alex, one more thing!" yells Brian before you leave.
"What?" you say turning around.
"Remember what I told you not to do!"
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Brian tries to explain things a bit

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
What did he mean when he said "Remember what I told you not to do?" Was he inferring that you'd actually try and get imminent with anyone in your current form? Despite all physical appearances, you're still male you wouldn't bite anyone, or kiss them. Or anything else that might compromise what's left of your masculinity.

Who does Brian think he is? He's acting like he's your dad or something. What does he know about being you? You came to him for some comfort. He was supposed to tell you that you'd be okay, no tell you what not to do. As you see a lone man walk across the street towards your direction, you eye him over. "Tell me what I can't do!" you think as you prepare to confront this stranger.

"What the hell?!" says the guy with a completely stunned look on his face as stop yourself just centimeters away from kissing the guy. "What the hell?" you say, stopping yourself.

You almost kissed a stranger.

The guy looks confused and scared. "Lady, get off me." he says in a stern voice.
"Get away from me, you freak!" you say without thinking as you push him away.

"That guy didn't lean in to kiss me. He didn't find me attractive." are the first thoughts that form in your head. "That guy was reacting to a strange woman coming at him. You can relate." says a calmer side of your brain.

Realizing what had just happened, you now start to fear that the female id inside of you is beginning to emerge with dangerous power. "But I didn't kiss him. I controlled myself to stop it." you try to justify your actions in your head. But he defiantly didn't lean in either." you think. "Did I lean in to kiss Alice?"

Suddenly your train of thought is broken, as you see two athletic guys walking towards you. Your mind slips into a fantasy, which involves you and them in your bedroom, with you walking around on all fours.
"Ya, I think it's time I lock myself away from the outside." you think as you head towards your dorm.
1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.title: Outside

1211111111111111111111111112111121111121.content:
Realizing that something beyond a physical change is drastically starting to affect you, you lock yourself in your dorm room.
"What's going on?" you think to yourself as you lean against the wall. There is an emptiness inside of you.
"It must be the curse." you think to yourself. (No shit Sherlock.)

You still find girls hot though, right? You close your eyes and try and think about why you love Emily.
